commit_message:
Remove snapd from stable branch images

The base size of the Ubuntu cloud image has continued to grow.
Recently the image build has started to fail because the image
runs out of disk space before the DIB cleanup steps run.
This patch removes the unused snapd components from the cloud image
to give DIB room to finish the image build.

(cherry picked from commit 05b57b4116aca1eca5686577ccff6f1da3b15de1)

Change-Id: I1c3ad2109099361b34c74afce4877e020b4c8d44

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-22 09:11:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'Placement' policies not translated

Some policies derived from standard policies are translated
by base policy translator. For example, a policy which has
`tosca.policies.tacker.Alarming` type derived from
`tosca.policies.Monitoring` type is translated by a translator to
`tosca.policies.Monitoring` type.

A policy which has a type derived from tosca.policies.Placement
doesn't seems to be translated by a translator to
`tosca.policies.Placement`.

This patch fixes this issue by adding the `tosca.policies.Placement`
specific check while translating nodetemplates.

This policy translation support is required to implement below
tacker blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/vdu-affinity-policy

Closes-Bug: #1755433
Change-Id: Ib265ac3add18027c91a601140a4f03a661603615
"}, {'created': '2018-05-30 08:56:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'Placement' policies not translated

Some policies derived from standard policies are translated
by base policy translator. For example, a policy which has
`tosca.policies.tacker.Alarming` type derived from
`tosca.policies.Monitoring` type is translated by a translator to
`tosca.policies.Monitoring` type.

A policy which has a type derived from tosca.policies.Placement
doesn't seems to be translated by a translator to
`tosca.policies.Placement`.

This patch fixes this issue by adding the `tosca.policies.Placement`
specific check while translating nodetemplates.

This policy translation support is required to implement below
tacker blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/vdu-affinity-policy

Closes-Bug: #1755433
Change-Id: Ib265ac3add18027c91a601140a4f03a661603615
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'Placement' policies not translated

Some policies derived from standard policies are translated
by base policy translator. For example, a policy which has
`tosca.policies.tacker.Alarming` type derived from
`tosca.policies.Monitoring` type is translated by a translator to
`tosca.policies.Monitoring` type.

A policy which has a type derived from tosca.policies.Placement
doesn't seems to be translated by a translator to
`tosca.policies.Placement`.

This patch fixes this issue by adding the `tosca.policies.Placement`
specific check while translating nodetemplates.

This policy translation support is required to implement below
tacker blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/vdu-affinity-policy

Closes-Bug: #1755433
Change-Id: Ib265ac3add18027c91a601140a4f03a661603615

commit_message:
Add networkd prefix when creating networks

systemd networkd is a shared directory of networks that needs to be able
to co-exist with the host which may be using networkd on it's own. This
change adds an nspawn specific networkd prefix to the interface files to
ensure we're not creating interface file collisions.

Change-Id: Id849fb69a6ec71dc3fa66e30e17b6143c81f5cc8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add an async to the networkd restart

When restarting networkd we don't need to wait for the restart to
complete. This change adds an async to speed things up.

Change-Id: I5e038f8a6fc00b476cfc505d8cc30929ba667127
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove snapd from stable branch images

The base size of the Ubuntu cloud image has continued to grow.
Recently the image build has started to fail because the image
runs out of disk space before the DIB cleanup steps run.
This patch removes the unused snapd components from the cloud image
to give DIB room to finish the image build.

(cherry picked from commit 05b57b4116aca1eca5686577ccff6f1da3b15de1)

Change-Id: I8c7944f78b4282543bfc4b0a686e71e506f7405c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 16:16:32.000000000', 'message': "Add element for openssh and override UseDNS

We need to disable UseDNS in default sshd_config, which is something we
already do when deploying SSHD service in puppet/services/sshd.yaml but
the parameter is still enabled before Puppet has run, which causes
problems when Ansible has to execute remote tasks via ssh, it timeouts.

This patch adds an element that will allow us to override the default
openssh configuration and it'll disable UseDNS.

Change-Id: I2df6c45936ee88e0eb048998ae23c9334f295fdf
Related-Bug: #1774557
"}]
commit_message:
Add element for openssh and override UseDNS

We need to disable UseDNS in default sshd_config, which is something we
already do when deploying SSHD service in puppet/services/sshd.yaml but
the parameter is still enabled before Puppet has run, which causes
problems when Ansible has to execute remote tasks via ssh, it timeouts.

This patch adds an element that will allow us to override the default
openssh configuration and it'll disable UseDNS.

Change-Id: I2df6c45936ee88e0eb048998ae23c9334f295fdf
Related-Bug: #1774557

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 13:34:47.000000000', 'message': "Add workaround for openstack-manila-ui plugin

The openstack-manila-ui package in RDO doesn't include the python plugin
scripts in its enabled directory as they are moved rather than copied
into /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/.

This change copies the plugins into the manila_ui python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ia9f941b8272199028e69836514984b33b474c057
Closes-Bug: #1774175
"}]
commit_message:
Add workaround for openstack-manila-ui plugin

The openstack-manila-ui package in RDO doesn't include the python plugin
scripts in its enabled directory as they are moved rather than copied
into /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/.

This change copies the plugins into the manila_ui python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ia9f941b8272199028e69836514984b33b474c057
Closes-Bug: #1774175

required bits.

commit_message:
defaults: Allow uwsgi to autoload required plugins.

Distributions normally package uwsgi in a modular fashion so we need
to be use the 'autoload' option to allow it to load all the required
plugins.

Change-Id: I09f6cc7bb129ba4cdf23793b670c8096f1377b8b
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Add networkd prefix when creating networks

systemd networkd is a shared directory of networks that needs to be able
to co-exist with the host which may be using networkd on it's own. This
change adds an nspawn specific networkd prefix to the interface files to
ensure we're not creating interface file collisions.

Change-Id: I1a9e25f697b64e292261cf0abf8df61a97dd2730
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Ignore errors when checking result of previous deployments

This always should have been ignore_errors:true, as we don't want to
fail when checking the result of the previous deployment. Instead, we
want to use the result as a trigger as to whether or not we should
re-run the deployment.

Change-Id: I6b75ea2a6096e152d7f01853de5da59cccc8e9ec

subject: Add a single variable for combined networks
messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-31 18:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-31 18:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to extra_networks'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-05-31 19:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think that this achieves something subtly different to allowing container_extra_networks to vary per container via host_vars/group_vars and thus create container specific interfaces at the point of container creation.

As the nspawn_hosts role is managing the creation of the host interfaces there are potentially situations where special *host* interfaces/bridges are needed that cannot/should not be defined in the dynamic inventory.

Perhaps in this case it is worth using a different var name, as it is extra host rather container interfaces that is being created.

I can see use cases for this "create br-external only on my haproxy and network nodes" which i'm not sure can be expressed in openstack_user_config.yml but could easily go into container_host_extra_networks in the right part of group_vars.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 17:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 17:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think that this achieves something subtly different to allowing
 > container_extra_networks to vary per container via
 > host_vars/group_vars and thus create container specific interfaces
 > at the point of container creation.

 > 
 > Perhaps in this case it is worth using a different var name, as it

 > 
 > I can see use cases for this "create br-external only on my haproxy
 > and network nodes" which i'm not sure can be expressed in
 > openstack_user_config.yml but could easily go into
 > container_host_extra_networks in the right part of group_vars.

done.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 21:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add a single variable for combined networks

The combined networks variable will allow deployers to set basic
container networks, default nspawn networks, and any "extra" networks a
deployer may need outside of a standard build.

Change-Id: I5346fdf81967d6eb7f69e61a187166c076ca4b60
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

As I have the patch for HierarchyQuotaDriver [1] I wonder why we restrict this. Spec wasn't approved for Ocata and I considered option
to make it in a separate library can be used by several projects.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391072/"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-01-02 02:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Andrey, this just restricts the quota_driver option from being able to dynamically load ANY quota driver, which would include drivers that are outside of nova. So unless I'm missing something, you're just adding a new quota driver (HierarchyQuotaDriver) and that would go into the 'choices' list for this option."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-01-05 12:42:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is this necessarily the correct way to go about this? We only use the Noop driver in tests, right? If so, couldn't we do this via monkey patching/mock? I've done something very similar with the XVP console driver option [1] after briefly flirting with the idea of moving it to stevedore

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408191/"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-01-05 12:43:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Is this necessarily the correct way to go about this? We only use

This is all based on the assumption that we would only have one other quota driver. I don't know if there are plans to add others here"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-01-05 13:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The HierarchyQuotaDriver being needed soon is a good reason to keep it.

Although the cells work to re-work the existing system is a good reason to kill what we have right now.

I am torn.

Anyways, what we have here is what I think we probably want in the short term while we make our minds up.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-01-05 13:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would prefer we moved this to stevedore to match virt driver, etc.

I mean you can do the no-op by correct configuration of the DB driver, but thats never going to be as efficient, I guess.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-06 18:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-05-30 11:02:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

To be clear I still don't understand reasoning behind this, could you explain please?
For example I like to modify logic of QuotaDriver, I'm writing
another class based on QuotaDriver and installing it as a separate python module. Without this change I can do that. With this change
I need to copy or link my file into nova code additionally."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-30 12:46:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> To be clear I still don't understand reasoning behind this, could
 > you explain please?
 > For example I like to modify logic of QuotaDriver, I'm writing
 > another class based on QuotaDriver and installing it as a separate
 > python module. Without this change I can do that. With this change
 > I need to copy or link my file into nova code additionally.

To the best of my knowledge, we only support the following out-of-tree components: scheduler filters, scheduler weigh(t)ers, virt drivers and scheduler drivers. Anything outside of that should be included in-tree. From your initial comments, it seemed like you wanted to include a new quota driver in-tree so this change wouldn't be an issue (as Matt points out). However, I'm guessing this isn't actually the case after all? If not, perhaps you should raise your concerns on openstack-dev (or the operators list) to get additional input? I will drop the +2 until that's resolved."}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-05-30 13:55:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

It's not an issue for me, right.
Just wanted to hear why.
So the answer by now is to make it similar with other options like filter driver, host manager and so on."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-31 21:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is why:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/policies.html#out-of-tree-support

Scheduler filters and scheduler hints are exceptions, along with the "hooks" entry points, but the hooks have been deprecated for a long time and we just haven't gotten around to removing some of that other stuff, but it's on the chopping block.

We have removed a lot of configurable out of tree things like basically all custom managers for the services (compute manager, conductor manager, scheduler manager, etc) along with customized RPC topics, because we just don't support customization that low in the stack since we (1) break it and then people complain and (2) it can break interoperability because that low-level behavior change can impact how the API works.

So if you have a quota driver that you want to add, you either propose it upstream or you live with the fork, and add your own fork code to hook it in (or revert this change out of tree).'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-31 21:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I honestly don't know why we don't just deprecate this and replace it with a

 check_quota=(True|False)

but regardless, limiting the values while we still have this is consistent with the direction we've been heading since forever."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-01 09:40:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I honestly don't know why we don't just deprecate this and replace
 > it with a
 > 
 > check_quota=(True|False)
 > 
 > but regardless, limiting the values while we still have this is
 > consistent with the direction we've been heading since forever.

Well, we're actually un-deprecating this here so that might not be the worst thing in the world to do. What do you think, Matt?"}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-06-01 09:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the explanation, makes sense for me then.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-01 12:43:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Well, we're actually un-deprecating this here so that might not be the worst thing in the world to do. What do you think, Matt?

I'm ambivalent. I don't know what things are going to look like if we ever add support for nested quotas via the keystone unified limits stuff, and if that will require a different quota driver (which is what Andrey has worked on and why he cares about this change)."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-06-01 13:33:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm ambivalent. I don't know what things are going to look like if
 > we ever add support for nested quotas via the keystone unified
 > limits stuff, and if that will require a different quota driver
 > (which is what Andrey has worked on and why he cares about this
 > change).

That's a fair point. I suppose we may want to be able to gradually convert from local to placement-based quotas or something too.

In the _long_ run I kinda expect we can/should remove this, but if there's a reason to have it now (sounds like there are at least two) then that's fine. But definitely want the options restricted."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:20:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> > I'm ambivalent. I don't know what things are going to look like
 > if
 > > we ever add support for nested quotas via the keystone unified
 > > limits stuff, and if that will require a different quota driver
 > > (which is what Andrey has worked on and why he cares about this
 > > change).
 > 
 > That's a fair point. I suppose we may want to be able to gradually
 > convert from local to placement-based quotas or something too.
 > 
 > In the _long_ run I kinda expect we can/should remove this, but if
 > there's a reason to have it now (sounds like there are at least
 > two) then that's fine. But definitely want the options restricted.

Ack. Given that there are currently ongoing changes here but nothing proposed, we don't want to block on this. Still think the release note change is valid but that's a nit and can be addressed separately."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Restrict CONF.quota.driver to DB and noop quota drivers

The quota driver config option was deprecated in Newton via
change 430638888c987a99e537e2ac956087a7310ecdc6. That was a
bit wrong in that the config option shouldn't have been
deprecated since we still use it, but we wanted to deprecate
the ability to load custom quota driver classes, which is done
in this change.

To be clear, this doesn't remove the option nor the ability
to configure the quota driver, it only removes the ability
to class-load out of tree quota drivers.

Change-Id: I021a2bcb923739409b393cbb2684ffdf20180f73

Since we've added ``scope_types`` as an attribute to policy rules, it
makes sense to include this information in documentation. End users

Closes-Bug: 1773473

commit_message:
Update sphinxext to include scope_types in docs

Since we've added ``scope_types`` as an attribute to policy rules, it
makes sense to include this information in documentation. End users
will need to know what type of scope is required to pass a specific
policy rule when services start incorporating system scope and scope
types.

Change-Id: I86d89e9f45740b39cef04773cec8846c1ab97c3a
Closes-Bug: 1773473

commit_message:
use retry_db_errors from neutron-lib

The externally consumed APIs from neutron.db.api were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557040/

This patch consumes the retry_db_errors from lib in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570016

It also bumps the neutron-lib version up to 1.14.0

Change-Id: I92a02d0441928667e911496208cda3bd56009fbc

commit_message:
Octavia devstack plugin API mode

For API drivers which only use API service, devstack needs:
- To skip creation of o-oh0 interface, as there's no amphora VMs
- Create endpoint, roles

Change-Id: I168b9ccc968a680ed2db326435f7523c35e7a020

[{'created': '2018-05-17 14:09:10.000000000', 'message': 'Adding ansible-runner to global-requirements

networking-ansible ML2 driver invokes ansible via an ASL 2.0 python
wrapper named ansible-runner.

Change-Id: I33725dbb61f0e6423ef358602822e2e6bcef4abd
'}, {'created': '2018-05-17 14:31:35.000000000', 'message': "Adding ansible-runner to global-requirements

networking-ansible ML2 driver invokes ansible via an ASL 2.0 python
wrapper named ansible-runner.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner
I've been working with the maintainers and they've been very responsive

Is the library good code?
Yes - Documentation has been good and contributing has been easy
stability has been good and good coding practices appear to be
practiced.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Not yet - The maintainers have it on the short list to add Py3 support
My project wants Py3 support and we are anticipating the support.

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - ASL 2.0

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
Fedora - Yes
Ubuntu - No

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
I don't believe so. Afaik it's the only distibuted lib that provides a
programatic interface to ansible.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
Yes - networking-ansible invokes it directly to manage switching
infrastructure via Ansible Networking

Change-Id: I33725dbb61f0e6423ef358602822e2e6bcef4abd

commit_message:
Adding ansible-runner to global-requirements

networking-ansible ML2 driver invokes ansible via an ASL 2.0 python
wrapper named ansible-runner.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner
I've been working with the maintainers and they've been very responsive

Is the library good code?
Yes - Documentation has been good and contributing has been easy
stability has been good and good coding practices appear to be
practiced.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes
https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner/commit/b86c50978e70526e952a1a19bc94997f99b98992

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - ASL 2.0

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
Fedora - Yes
Ubuntu - No

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
I don't believe so. Afaik it's the only distibuted lib that provides a
programatic interface to ansible.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
Yes - networking-ansible invokes it directly to manage switching
infrastructure via Ansible Networking

Change-Id: I33725dbb61f0e6423ef358602822e2e6bcef4abd

[{'created': '2018-05-31 08:45:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nova_console_novnc_ssl.yml include path

This was broken since this include was moved into a subdirectory with
commit 33b24727247bf37bafe0a328d20526df6322f19c.

For all other includes moved with the above commit this was fixed in

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 21:51:37.000000000', 'message': "Run image prepare after registry install

For containerized undercloud install this completes the image
preperation. The flow for undercloud install is now:

1. Early in tripleo deploy there is a dry-run prepare which generates
the heat environment for all of the image parameters
2. Here after the registry is installed, populate it by running
prepare again

This file is now a jinja template so that the prepare command has
access to the roles data. This reduces the number of images processed
to services which *might* be containerized, but we can't filter by
services which *are* containerised because we're inside the heat stack
and don't have access to the full heat environment. The actual image
numbers are:
136 prepare with no filtering
97 prepare filtering only by roles_data_undercloud.yaml
64 prepare with undercloud env+roles_data_undercloud.yaml filtering

This might be a time hit for undercloud jobs, but hopefully not
a big hit for undercloud+overcloud jobs because many of those extra images
will be used in the overcloud.

Change-Id: I7449ee364ec9e976fbe9df95024ce3c42f6459b5
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
"}]
commit_message:
Run image prepare after registry install

For containerized undercloud install this completes the image
preperation. The flow for undercloud install is now:

1. Early in tripleo deploy there is a dry-run prepare which generates
the heat environment for all of the image parameters
2. Here after the registry is installed, populate it by running
prepare again

This file is now a jinja template so that the prepare command has
access to the roles data. This reduces the number of images processed
to services which *might* be containerized, but we can't filter by
services which *are* containerised because we're inside the heat stack
and don't have access to the full heat environment. The actual image
numbers are:
136 prepare with no filtering
97 prepare filtering only by roles_data_undercloud.yaml
64 prepare with undercloud env+roles_data_undercloud.yaml filtering

This might be a time hit for undercloud jobs, but hopefully not
a big hit for undercloud+overcloud jobs because many of those extra images
will be used in the overcloud.

Change-Id: I7449ee364ec9e976fbe9df95024ce3c42f6459b5
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Handle rebuild of instances with image traits

Update the conductor to handle rebuilding of an instance. If a rebuild
is requested with an image with traits, we check the current allocations
of the instance against the image required traits and allow the action
only if the current allocations can satisfy the image requirements.

Fix minor comments from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560596/

Taking over the work from Arvind

Change-Id: I1d6aeccc77647438404ffdf6dba071bfd88a98f6
Implements: blueprint glance-image-traits

Tamas - I'm confused - the fwaas_v2 stuff is not implemented in master/queens. Are those using the v2 plugin only, or does a patch need to be implemented in master to cater for the same thing?"}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:45:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jesse, I'm using the pike release, and I created the fix for the problem, that the neutron-fwaas-dashboard can installing with v1 and v2 version of fwaas also."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Tamas OK, so is the fwaas v1 and v2 plugin both applicable to Queens/Rocky also? Or is that exclusively using v2?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I ask because if we merge this patch, then Queens does not have the same capability, nor Rocky, so it will cause a regression. This means that if the v1/v2 dashboards are both applicable for later branches, then a patch should be made to the master branch to add the v2 dashboard. We merge that, then backport.'}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The v1 and v2 version of fwaas are work in Queens and Rocky release as far as I know.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-24 10:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Is there a reason why we don't just switch to using the v2 dashboard here, instead of supporting both?"}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-05-24 10:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The neutron-fwaas-dashboard is support for both versions, and I thought to implement both.'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-05-24 10:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-24 12:10:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Tamas - in that case I'm inclined to use the new one instead and drop the old one. Please adjust accordingly, then add 'Co-Authored-By: name <name@example.com>' with your details in the commit message. The commit message should also be adjusted to say what it's doing, and there should be a release note added (using 'reno') to describe the impact to deployers."}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-05-24 12:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Jesse, you think that drop the old fwaas v1 version, and I use only fwaas v2 version?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-24 12:25:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes, so we don't need to introduce a new variable - we just switch to using the new version only."}, {'account_id': 27940, 'date': '2018-05-24 12:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 21:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds workaround solution ported from eventlet patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013
(cherry picked from commit 04efb3bca33cb4ca49f29e548866ad6f5d0ed359)

commit_message:
Add a single variable for combined networks

The combined networks variable will allow deployers to set basic
container networks, default nspawn networks, and any "extra" networks a
deployer may need outside of a standard build.

Change-Id: I0cfed0ad6cce99c420c31920446e0a69a82fa602
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Force create default/mysql to mariadb symlink

When doing an upgrade, if the mysql default file exists,
the creation of the symlink will fail.  Setting to force
ensures the symlink is created correctly.

Change-Id: Icbab1d4e7edaa853c62a364ed6a6baa5fec60058

[{'created': '2018-05-30 08:25:21.000000000', 'message': 'Vagrantfile: Add openSUSE Leap 15.0 support

openSUSE Leap 15.0 has been released on the 25th of May 2018 so we add
support for it in the Vagrantfile. Moreover, we move away from the Bento
boxes because they are not being updated very often so we spend a lot of
time updating the base OS during tests. Moreover, the current releases
(due to being old) cause troubles like missing systemd-networkd and
vagrant user on openSUSE, old udev on CentOS etc.

Change-Id: I64696e1bf36de1b7e7a6ce206bd61539ae32b1f9
'}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Add openSUSE Leap 15.0 support

openSUSE Leap 15.0 has been released on the 25th of May 2018 so we add
support for it in the Vagrantfile. Moreover, we move away from the Bento
boxes because they are not being updated very often so we spend a lot of
time updating the base OS during tests. Moreover, the current releases
(due to being old) cause troubles like missing systemd-networkd and
vagrant user on openSUSE, old udev on CentOS etc.

Change-Id: I64696e1bf36de1b7e7a6ce206bd61539ae32b1f9

subject: Move database creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-01 13:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 21:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 13:54:53.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'gnocchi_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable gnocchi_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: Idff20080d825e5afd071cbc03055f96c920aff9d
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'gnocchi_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable gnocchi_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: Idff20080d825e5afd071cbc03055f96c920aff9d

The lxc_cmd variable is being set when we collect log information for
containers but it is not unset when we do the same thing on the host. As
a result of which, the host repo and pkg logs were wrong since they were
collected from the last container instead of the host.

Change-Id: If2d0a84b46538e44f383967108ca9f67e91f5054
(cherry picked from commit a6ed5f3dc6db9e3fbf4db1473d0cb1bb261dc9ca)

commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Fix log collection for host

The lxc_cmd variable is being set when we collect log information for
containers but it is not unset when we do the same thing on the host. As
a result of which, the host repo and pkg logs were wrong since they were
collected from the last container instead of the host.

Change-Id: If2d0a84b46538e44f383967108ca9f67e91f5054
(cherry picked from commit a6ed5f3dc6db9e3fbf4db1473d0cb1bb261dc9ca)

subject: [Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers
messages: [{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-01 09:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-01 09:24:36.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1750337-stable/pike to bug/1750337'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-01 19:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-01 19:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 09:23:21.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)
"}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)

When the repositories change, the apt cache needs updating to bring
in the new indexes. Recently this has failed quite often. In the
hope that we can get more diagnostic information, and in order to

commit_message:
Split the apt cache update when repos change from the install task

When the repositories change, the apt cache needs updating to bring
in the new indexes. Recently this has failed quite often. In the
hope that we can get more diagnostic information, and in order to
make the tasks a litte easier to read, we split them into two.

Change-Id: I4b1bb0d3c318a1f07b4a1d055faed65691565320

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 16:01:38.000000000', 'message': "[placement] default to accept of application/json when */*

In change Ice27c7080fc2df097cb387f7438c0aaf32b4c63d the placement api
was changed to set the accept header to application/json if the accept
header was not set. This was done to ensure that error responses are
formatted as JSON in the face of automation that webob does when
formatting errors.

That change was incomplete. Apparently many clients, notably requests,
which backs keystoneauth1, sets a default Accept header of '*/*'. This
is a reasonable default but means our error formatting default can go
awry.

This fixes it in the simplest way possible. See the referenced change
above for discussion on why doing this with a microversion would be
pointless.

Tested with a simple gabbi confirmation.

Change-Id: I3df5b9fb8fe7c0e41f7e1f495758973423485e11
Closes-Bug: #1771384
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] default to accept of application/json when */*

In change Ice27c7080fc2df097cb387f7438c0aaf32b4c63d the placement api
was changed to set the accept header to application/json if the accept
header was not set. This was done to ensure that error responses are
formatted as JSON in the face of automation that webob does when
formatting errors.

That change was incomplete. Apparently many clients, notably requests,
which backs keystoneauth1, sets a default Accept header of '*/*'. This
is a reasonable default but means our error formatting default can go
awry.

This fixes it in the simplest way possible. See the referenced change
above for discussion on why doing this with a microversion would be
pointless.

Tested with a simple gabbi confirmation.

Change-Id: I3df5b9fb8fe7c0e41f7e1f495758973423485e11
Closes-Bug: #1771384

commit_message:
Fix local path for templates outside of the plan

In some cases, the local path of templates can be
wrong. For example, if a local path have double
slash, this will result to a failure when the
deployment workflow will launch http request with
double slash.

Change-Id: I91a38cbc6b67bdc5e6303f3ae1930f77103d7987

commit_message:
Correct cluster name check

When checking for failed states the cluster name is gathered using
stdout however the conditional is not checking stdout and is attempting
to split a hash which fails rendering an obscure error. This change just
makes the conditional look at stdout and split on a sting.

Change-Id: I73c76fc83274e6f9a0157ad5a75797bebd682adb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 78ea059c93605f90019401bfc1c0ece3f5d2c242)

[{'created': '2018-05-14 16:07:27.000000000', 'message': 'Setup /dev/random and /dev/urandom device in cache prep (ubuntu/suse)

In the cache preparation stage, there are certain libraries that
depend on the existance of /dev/random and /dev/urandom in order
to be able to function correctly, such as NSS in the latest CentOS
release (7.5)

This patch adds those nodes so that the libraries are able to use
them with no problems, allowing yum and rpm specifically to work
properly again.

This was done for all distributions in [1], but the backports only
did it for RedHat.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/567585

Change-Id: Ib59aad2f2577d2f67c3ca6dc4ec20cfadd8ee960
(cherry picked from commit 741e6640c3d7d50f00d73d44c3e9c2d89ebfcd74)
'}]
commit_message:
Setup /dev/random and /dev/urandom device in cache prep (ubuntu/suse)

In the cache preparation stage, there are certain libraries that
depend on the existance of /dev/random and /dev/urandom in order
to be able to function correctly, such as NSS in the latest CentOS
release (7.5)

This patch adds those nodes so that the libraries are able to use
them with no problems, allowing yum and rpm specifically to work
properly again.

This was done for all distributions in [1], but the backports only
did it for RedHat.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/567585

Change-Id: Ib59aad2f2577d2f67c3ca6dc4ec20cfadd8ee960
(cherry picked from commit 741e6640c3d7d50f00d73d44c3e9c2d89ebfcd74)

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated lines

In case where /etc/network/interfaces already contains a similar
line, it is superseeded.

Change-Id: I38f244d093e002f8bc90412c1eacd254ffe31514

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 16:09:16.000000000', 'message': 'Setup /dev/random and /dev/urandom device in cache prep (ubuntu/suse)

In the cache preparation stage, there are certain libraries that
depend on the existance of /dev/random and /dev/urandom in order
to be able to function correctly, such as NSS in the latest CentOS
release (7.5)

This patch adds those nodes so that the libraries are able to use
them with no problems, allowing yum and rpm specifically to work
properly again.

This was done for all distributions in [1], but the backports only
did it for RedHat.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/567585

Change-Id: Ib59aad2f2577d2f67c3ca6dc4ec20cfadd8ee960
(cherry picked from commit 741e6640c3d7d50f00d73d44c3e9c2d89ebfcd74)
'}]
commit_message:
Setup /dev/random and /dev/urandom device in cache prep (ubuntu/suse)

In the cache preparation stage, there are certain libraries that
depend on the existance of /dev/random and /dev/urandom in order
to be able to function correctly, such as NSS in the latest CentOS
release (7.5)

This patch adds those nodes so that the libraries are able to use
them with no problems, allowing yum and rpm specifically to work
properly again.

This was done for all distributions in [1], but the backports only
did it for RedHat.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/567585

Change-Id: Ib59aad2f2577d2f67c3ca6dc4ec20cfadd8ee960
(cherry picked from commit 741e6640c3d7d50f00d73d44c3e9c2d89ebfcd74)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 11:25:18.000000000', 'message': "Change ovs release used to compile kernel module for tests node

In some test jobs, like fullstack and ovsfw-scenario job
openvswitch kernel module is compiled from source before tests.
This compilation was failing because of new kernel 4.4.0-127 provided
by Ubuntu.

Kernel module will be compiled from source which contains
fix for this change in kernel.
See related openvswitch commit message for details:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/138df3e563de9da0e5a4155b3534a69621495742

As current Ubuntu uses ovs 2.9.0 we don't need to compile ovs for
ovsfw-scenario-job anymore because fix we needed is already contained
in ovs 2.9.0.

Change-Id: Idc34776e5b2fad105e246f7718220c23f0a94164
Closes-bug: #1772689
(cherry picked from commit edc909a26793584fa7cf07ba84b0cad4c26b3275)
"}]
commit_message:
Change ovs release used to compile kernel module for tests node

In some test jobs, like fullstack and ovsfw-scenario job
openvswitch kernel module is compiled from source before tests.
This compilation was failing because of new kernel 4.4.0-127 provided
by Ubuntu.

Kernel module will be compiled from source which contains
fix for this change in kernel.
See related openvswitch commit message for details:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/138df3e563de9da0e5a4155b3534a69621495742

As current Ubuntu uses ovs 2.9.0 we don't need to compile ovs for
ovsfw-scenario-job anymore because fix we needed is already contained
in ovs 2.9.0.

Change-Id: Idc34776e5b2fad105e246f7718220c23f0a94164
Closes-bug: #1772689
(cherry picked from commit edc909a26793584fa7cf07ba84b0cad4c26b3275)

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-23 23:32:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)

Also, for backward compatibility where today admin means basically global system scope admin, I'm not sure if we should just make everything system scope, except it gets hard-coded in the policy and operators aren't able to override it, right?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-05-24 00:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

I'm not sure I fully understand the meaning of 'scope' but it seems to me that the scope should be based on what can or should be attending to the resources, and in placement, most of them are "the system".

Thus far we've only talked about accessing /usages in a way that is not "the system". While allocations do have user and project information in them, we haven't really discussed people being able to read or write "their allocations". Instead, systems (like nova) do it for them. Would we want them to?

Resource classes, traits, other metadata is all system, yeah, because it is the system that owns and manipulates those things. One can imagine a future where some services which don't exist might want to manage those things in a projecty kind of way, but we're not there yet.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2018-05-24 18:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-24 21:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-24 21:12:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

@cdent: yeah that's what I struggle with on the scope stuff. The easy thing right now is to just say everything is system scope. I don't expect end users to be looking at their allocations, plus if they could, they could get an idea of the computes in the system (not hostnames, but counts)."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-24 21:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

This looks excellent, thank you for working on this effort, Matt.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2018-05-25 00:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2018-05-25 00:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

So far the implementation looks fine. I will have to take more time to properly reviews all the changes in the topic.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-25 05:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-25 14:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-05-31 05:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

joining thread late. lgtm and it keep backward compatibility.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-31 18:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 23:10:06.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: General policy sample file for placement

This starts some bare bones work to generate a policy
sample for placement. The placement policy code needs
to change to actually read from the file so deployers
can configure custom policy rules.

Change-Id: I17573f5210314341c332fdcb1ce462a989c21940
'}, {'created': '2018-04-26 16:18:38.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: General policy sample file for placement

Change-Id: I17573f5210314341c332fdcb1ce462a989c21940
'}, {'created': '2018-04-26 21:16:03.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: General policy sample file for placement

TODO: tests, docs, reno, split up the changes, etc

sample for placement. The placement policy code needs

Change-Id: I17573f5210314341c332fdcb1ce462a989c21940
'}, {'created': '2018-04-26 23:55:21.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Implement granular policy rules for placement

TODO: tests, reno, split up the changes, etc

This adds a granular policy checking framework for
placement based on nova.policy but with a lot of
the legacy cruft removed, like the is_admin and
context_is_admin rules.

A new PlacementPolicyFixture is added along with
a new configuration option, [placement]/policy_file,
which is needed because the default policy file
that gets used in config is from [oslo_policy]/policy_file
which is being used by /etc/nova/policy.json. As
far as I can tell, oslo.policy doesn't allow for
multiple policy files with different names unless
I'm misunderstanding how the policy_dirs option works.

With these changes, we can have something like:

  /etc/nova/policy.json - for nova policy rules
  /etc/nova/placement-policy.yaml - for placement rules

The docs are also updated to include the placement
policy sample along with a tox builder for the sample.

This starts by adding granular rules for CRUD operations
on the /resource_providers and /resource_providers/{uuid}
routes which use the same descriptions from the placement
API reference. Subsequent patches will add new granular
rules for the other routes.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I17573f5210314341c332fdcb1ce462a989c21940

which is being used as the nova policy file. As
far as I can tell, oslo.policy doesn't allow for
multiple policy files with different names unless
I'm misunderstanding how the policy_dirs option works.

With these changes, we can have something like:

  /etc/nova/policy.json - for nova policy rules
  /etc/nova/placement-policy.yaml - for placement rules

The docs are also updated to include the placement
policy sample along with a tox builder for the sample.

This starts by adding granular rules for CRUD operations
on the /resource_providers and /resource_providers/{uuid}
routes which use the same descriptions from the placement
API reference. Subsequent patches will add new granular
rules for the other routes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568835

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I17573f5210314341c332fdcb1ce462a989c21940

commit_message:
Implement granular policy rules for placement

This adds a granular policy checking framework for
placement based on nova.policy but with a lot of
the legacy cruft removed, like the is_admin and
context_is_admin rules.

A new PlacementPolicyFixture is added along with
a new configuration option, [placement]/policy_file,
which is needed because the default policy file
that gets used in config is from [oslo_policy]/policy_file
which is being used as the nova policy file. As
far as I can tell, oslo.policy doesn't allow for
multiple policy files with different names unless
I'm misunderstanding how the policy_dirs option works.

With these changes, we can have something like:

  /etc/nova/policy.json - for nova policy rules
  /etc/nova/placement-policy.yaml - for placement rules

The docs are also updated to include the placement
policy sample along with a tox builder for the sample.

This starts by adding granular rules for CRUD operations
on the /resource_providers and /resource_providers/{uuid}
routes which use the same descriptions from the placement
API reference. Subsequent patches will add new granular
rules for the other routes.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I17573f5210314341c332fdcb1ce462a989c21940

[{'created': '2018-06-01 20:42:37.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust flat networking

This adjusts the VM networking to only create the additional veth pair for the
flat bridge.  Without this the other bridges can get IPs other than those
statically assigned by the DHCP server.  This also adjusts the range to exclude

Change-Id: I289e808b5acb68b1c51e05cbe7d914077c20ba1a
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust flat networking

This adjusts the VM networking to only create the additional veth pair for the
flat bridge.  Without this the other bridges can get IPs other than those
statically assigned by the DHCP server.  This also adjusts the range to exclude
the statically assigned ranges.

Change-Id: I289e808b5acb68b1c51e05cbe7d914077c20ba1a

commit_message:
Stop passing IP address to IPA by PXE

CoreOS version for Ironic Python Agent was upgraded in the Rocky. An
IPA built on CoreOS doesn't boot from PXE. A new validation added to
CoreOS doesn't allow 'ip' parameter passed by PXE when DHCP is used.
This patch changes 'ipappend' parameter in PXE configuration not to
pass 'ip' parameter.

Change-Id: I6d5ca3a51fcbe95bd9e541a6f5ad2f7352c86a6e
Story: 2002093
Task: 19771

commit_message:
Make max_burst_kbps option as optional for bw limit QoS rule

Attribute max_burst_kbps of QoS bandwidth limit rule in Neutron's
is optional in API so it should be also optional on client's side.

Change-Id: Ie085b73fa885ff12f9ac080666cf3ca6a09b632a
Related-Bug:#1770622
Task: 19658
Story: 2002017

commit_message:
Mount /var/run/redis for the redis socket

Under pacemaker, it manages this mount correctly. When not deploying
redis with pacemaker, the /var/run/redis folder is not properly mounted
so the container cannot start correctly after a reboot.

Change-Id: I1b86bc91e7ca95a1e70fecee1b6507787d98e9cd
Closes-Bug: #1771888
(cherry picked from commit 1d9629ec0b3320bcbc5a4150c8be19c6eb4096eb)

commit_message:
Add timeout options to listener resource

This commit adds timeout_client_data, timeout_member_connect,
timeout_member_data, timeout_tcp_inspect to `listener create` and
`listener set`.

Story: 1457556
Task: 12487
Change-Id: I495fcbcc395f1c7314943fcdcd4d300b192913e8

  tempest.api.identity.v2.test_users.IdentityUsersTest.
  test_user_update_own_password are failing due to

commit_message:
Updated undercloud tempest skip list for Ocata

* tempest.api.identity.v2.test_tenants.IdentityTenantsTest.
  test_list_tenants_returns_only_authorized_tenants and
  tempest.api.identity.v2.test_users.IdentityUsersTest.
  test_user_update_own_password are failing due to
  admin_required permission issue. We will adding to skip list
  in order to pass the CI.

* It is already skipped in Pike.

Change-Id: I50ca5a4818fa481b6e7fe66eefdd84bf377d5a6d

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 20:54:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when a network contains more that one IPv4
subnet, they are returned in the 'classless-static-routes'
DHCP option, regardless of whether DHCP is enabled for them
or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for
synchronizing networks after the dhcp agent restarts filters
subnets with "enable_dhcp=True", which differs from the
get_network_info() method.  This will block VM access to
other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets, even though they are
in the same network.  This is visible by looking at the "opts"
file before and after a restart.

Change the dhcp agent to ask for all subnets in its
get_active_networks_info() RPC call by adding an
enable_dhcp_filter argument to toggle the behavior, with the
default being True to not break backwards compatibility.

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352530/ by Quan Tian.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: I11ca1d1a603d02587f3b8d4a5a52a96b0587d61f
Closes-Bug: #1652654

commit_message:
Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when a network contains more that one IPv4
subnet, they are returned in the 'classless-static-routes'
DHCP option, regardless of whether DHCP is enabled for them
or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for
synchronizing networks after the dhcp agent restarts filters
subnets with "enable_dhcp=True", which differs from the
get_network_info() method.  This will block VM access to
other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets, even though they are
in the same network.  This is visible by looking at the "opts"
file before and after a restart.

Change the dhcp agent to ask for all subnets in its
get_active_networks_info() RPC call by adding an
enable_dhcp_filter argument to toggle the behavior, with the
default being True to not break backwards compatibility.

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352530/ by Quan Tian.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: I11ca1d1a603d02587f3b8d4a5a52a96b0587d61f
Closes-Bug: #1652654

commit_message:
Set ovsdb probe interval to 1 minute on the client side

When a failover of ovsdb-server occurs, neither neutron-server nor
ovn-metadata-agent detects the disconnection. Even though this should
be fixed in OVS Python IDL, this patch is adding a default probe
interval from the client side to 60 seconds. This way, when the
connection to the VIP is lost, clients will reconnect and the service
will be back up again.

Change-Id: Idec3344136a85d73969ed8e11d358b66c14d9a4d
Closes-Bug: #1772656
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove irrelevant-files from legacy-rally-dsvm-verify-full-discover-resources

This job has both files and irrelevant-files in its gate variant.
The check job only has files.  Having both is very confusing, and
most of the time just works out to be the files matcher anyway.
An upcoming change to zuul will prohibit having both on the same
variant, so remove the irrelevant-files from this one, as that's
likely what was intended anyway.

Change-Id: I49291b0702e468e4d947b9fc839bdf2a86d777a1

commit_message:
Change the type name on ES for fluent-logging

The type name is 'fluentd' which is a default value from fluentd
Fluent-logging should have its own name.
So, 'fluent' is a better name.

blueprint fluent-logging-change-type-name

Change-Id: I101790a3e9cb4c8d72f0426efb620151f662be58

commit_message:
[WIP] build-openstack-sphinx-docs exclude neutron/tests

When the build-openstack-sphinx-docs job runs, it should exclude the
neutron/tests directory.  This directory is not needed for
documentation, and can cause test breakage.

Change-Id: I24840f1d910d29c542d6fa37ed817635f2a70bc4

commit_message:
Image show: print human readable string when the virtual size is unknown

Currently, when the virtual size of an image is not known, "None" is displayed.
To a regular user, it feels like a programming error. We try and make things
clearer by using a "human readable" string instead.

Change-Id: Id7b8799356857d9bc58cc8a3677024fe1a7f4f56
Partial-Bug: #1665037

commit_message:
Remove beaker test on trusty for infracloud

We're not currently running infracloud and if/when we do it will
probably not be on trusty. This is the only project using this job
template, so if we remove it from this project definition we can remove
the template from openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: Iaca866bbcdf9e89d838b750953ba0bf60eab683b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 13:35:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox-py27 stable jobs of networking-bgpvpn

openstack-tox-py27 stable jobs fail for networking-bgpvpn for a couple
of weeks now. The problem according to the logs [1] [2]:

ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-odl not found
In Zuul v3 all repositories used need to be declared
in the 'required-projects' parameter on the job.
To fix this issue, add:
  openstack/networking-odl
to 'required-projects'.

On master tox_install.sh is already removed, but on stable branches it is
still there, and networking-odl should be installed with it, but somehow
it is failing in zuul.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27/3e009ea/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-17_06_17_40_436575
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/stable/pike/openstack-tox-py27/2d63b40/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-17_06_14_11_899842

Change-Id: I89fd8fc85bad9a7867e392b34d297644f76873ee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tox-py27 stable jobs of networking-bgpvpn

openstack-tox-py27 stable jobs fail for networking-bgpvpn for a couple
of weeks now. The problem according to the logs [1] [2]:

ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-odl not found
In Zuul v3 all repositories used need to be declared
in the 'required-projects' parameter on the job.
To fix this issue, add:
  openstack/networking-odl
to 'required-projects'.

On master tox_install.sh is already removed, but on stable branches it is
still there, and networking-odl should be installed with it, but somehow
it is failing in zuul.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27/3e009ea/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-17_06_17_40_436575
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/stable/pike/openstack-tox-py27/2d63b40/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-17_06_14_11_899842

Change-Id: I89fd8fc85bad9a7867e392b34d297644f76873ee

commit_message:
update cmd2 dependency to handle py3 only versions

cmd2 released a python3 only versions of itself.  We need to update
requirements to handle it.  This updates requirements to match
requirements.  See https://review.openstack.org/570811 for more details.

Depends-On: I568e649ec5fdd0bf875d7ac3ff630e9b6bae6426
Change-Id: I3d527ba30205c9f3b3b2e89f795ee5611422c013
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5e4b3bedc073bed61716ae7e47780d8192a1c34f)

[{'created': '2018-05-31 18:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'Stop logging success in case of error

commit_message:
Stop logging success in case of error

If an exception is thrown when creating or deleting a network, we log
the failure at error level. However, we were also logging success at
info level right after.

This patch logs success at info level only if no exception was thrown.

Change-Id: I4782d7813acf3cf12746fb1d968642b4796a7b5a

Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

Change-Id: Ic89fc78fe62267f95ac09e2c377f032a0313b5ba

commit_message:
Fix readme formatting issues

$ python setup.py check -r -s
running check
warning: check: Unexpected indentation. (line 63)

error: Please correct your package

Change-Id: I26057e9e2f86f092e04efd3f56f7d55be937f2de
Related-Bug: #1774001
(cherry picked from commit 51291f1460f6ada6039558c8231de82db0d6cb22)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 15:50:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph converge environment should clear Upgrade params

To switch repos during ceph upgrade we use UpgradeInitCommand
which we need to clear up during converge.

Change-Id: Id1eb4c3d93ae8f36adb8ab4fa2df570a6a76951f
Resolves: rhbz#1558787
Closes-Bug: 1770191
'}, {'created': '2018-05-14 13:09:46.000000000', 'message': 'Clear up Upgrade params on converge

During FFWD Upgrade or Minor Update we should still make sure
we clear Upgrade params too.

Resolves: rhbz#1558787
Closes-Bug: 1770191
Change-Id: Id1eb4c3d93ae8f36adb8ab4fa2df570a6a76951f
'}]
commit_message:
Clear up Upgrade params on converge

During FFWD Upgrade or Minor Update we should still make sure
we clear Upgrade params too.

Resolves: rhbz#1558787
Closes-Bug: 1770191
Change-Id: Id1eb4c3d93ae8f36adb8ab4fa2df570a6a76951f

commit_message:
Manage public certificate with ansible

This is basically a rewrite of the bash script pushed by
puppet/extraconfig/tls/tls-cert-inject.yaml

UpgradeImpact: NodeTLSData is not used anymore

Change-Id: Iaf7386207e5bd8b336759f51e4405fe15114123a

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4825e82b62955d6192b972344896156913adcdec
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-30 10:47:18.000000000', 'message': 'doc: update doc to refer new trusted tag for SRI-OV

It allows Virtual Functions to become “trusted” by the Physical
Function and perform some privileged operations, such as enabling VF
promiscuous mode and changing VF MAC address within the guest. The
inability to modify MAC addresses in the guest prevents the users from
being able to easily set up two VFs in a fail-over bond in a
guest. This spec aims to suggest a way for users to boot instances
with trusted VFs.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/sriov-trusted-vfs.html

commit_message:
doc: update doc to refer new trusted tag for SR-IOV

It allows Virtual Functions to become “trusted” by the Physical
Function and perform some privileged operations, such as enabling VF
promiscuous mode and changing VF MAC address within the guest. The
inability to modify MAC addresses in the guest prevents the users from
being able to easily set up two VFs in a fail-over bond in a
guest. This spec aims to suggest a way for users to boot instances
with trusted VFs.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/sriov-trusted-vfs.html

Change-Id: I58cbfd9698a6c7832abc52e0be70eab72f66e11a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/458820/
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/510897/17/ : FAILURE in 1h 48m 59s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-01 10:13:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

(2 comments)

I _still_ don't understand why we didn't use the 'isolate' policy for this, providing a path to getting rid of the 1 core per instance pattern that's both difficult to account for in placement world and which no one seems to actually want. That ship has sailed though. One comment inline that I'd be happy to see addressed in a follow-up, if necessary"}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-06-01 12:55:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

(1 comment)

Again Stephen and as discussed on the spec and some previous patches I think :) We don't want remove 'isolate' ability. The aim here is to add flexibility so when 'CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set' will be configured, using 'hw:emulator_threds_policy' with:

- '(empty/not-set)' means emulator threads float across the pCPUs dedicated for the guest
- 'share' means emulator threads float across the pCPUs configured in CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set
- 'isolate' means an addition host CPU will be allocated to pin the guest emulator threads on."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Again Stephen and as discussed on the spec and some previous
 > patches I think :) We don't want remove 'isolate' ability. The aim
 > here is to add flexibility so when 'CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set'
 > will be configured, using 'hw:emulator_threds_policy' with:
 > 
 > - '(empty/not-set)' means emulator threads float across the pCPUs
 > dedicated for the guest
 > - 'share' means emulator threads float across the pCPUs configured
 > in CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set
 > - 'isolate' means an addition host CPU will be allocated to pin the
 > guest emulator threads on.

Indeed. I'm just making it known that I didn't think the isolate case was necessary any more with this change in tow (as noted with "That ship has sailed though").

Given my one real concern is addressed, I'm +2 now.'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 08:13:50.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: place emulator threads on CONF.cpu_shared_set

Some workloads run best when the hypervisor overhead processes
(emulator threads in libvirt/QEMU) can be placed on different physical
host CPUs than other guest CPU resources. This allows those workloads
to prevent latency spikes for guest vCPU threads.

To place emulator threads on a set of isolated physical CPUs, set the
``CONF.cpu_shared_set`` configuration option to the set of host CPUs
that should be used for best-effort CPU resources. Then set a flavor
extra spec to ``hw:emulator_threads_policy=share`` to instruct nova to
place that workload's emulator threads on that set of host CPUs.

implement: bp/overhead-pin-set
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0e63ab37d584ee3d7fde6553efaa61bfc866e67d

commit_message:
libvirt: place emulator threads on CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set

Some workloads run best when the hypervisor overhead processes
(emulator threads in libvirt/QEMU) can be placed on different physical
host CPUs than other guest CPU resources. This allows those workloads
to prevent latency spikes for guest vCPU threads.

To ensure emulator threads are placed on a different set of physical
CPUs than those running guest dedicated vCPUs, set the
``CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set`` configuration option to the set of host
CPUs that should be used for best-effort CPU resources. Then set a
flavor extra spec to ``hw:emulator_threads_policy=share`` to instruct
nova to place that workload's emulator threads on that set of host CPUs.

implement: bp/overhead-pin-set
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0e63ab37d584ee3d7fde6553efaa61bfc866e67d

[{'created': '2018-05-31 23:58:17.000000000', 'message': 'Correct cluster name check

When checking for failed states the cluster name is gathered using
stdout however the conditional is not checking stdout and is attempting
to split a hash which fails rendering an obscure error. This change just
makes the conditional look at stdout and split on a sting.

Change-Id: I73c76fc83274e6f9a0157ad5a75797bebd682adb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Correct cluster name check

When checking for failed states the cluster name is gathered using
stdout however the conditional is not checking stdout and is attempting
to split a hash which fails rendering an obscure error. This change just
makes the conditional look at stdout and split on a sting.

Change-Id: I73c76fc83274e6f9a0157ad5a75797bebd682adb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Implement pypi-based install and package pinning for non u-c packages

Rally does not adhere to the global requirements process, so its
requirements extend beyond those managed by upper-constraints, and
sometimes are incompatible with upper constraints.

We have no need to track their development from git commit to git
commit, and can rather rely on stable releases which we verify are
working with the upper constraints whenever we do a pinning bump.

This keeps things simpler for us, and also allows the repo build
process in the integrated build to do a constrained venv build
instead of doing it unconstrained and breaking stable branch builds
down the line.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570906
Change-Id: If3d0120cf6f6f78463cf7805bc046382c3b6d44e

commit_message:
Fix the README formatting

PyPI is now stricter about this, we need this change for any future
releases.

The easiest way to test this is by running the following command in a
virtualenv with docutils.

    python setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict

Related: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568881/
Change-Id: I6734d4ef44af430ee6232e2235be9de493806324

commit_message:
Fix the README formatting

PyPI is now stricter about this, we need this change for any future
releases.

The easiest way to test this is by running the following command in a
virtualenv with docutils.

    python setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict

Related: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568881/

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2017-06-27 09:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 22003, 'date': '2017-06-27 10:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Should I set them even if it means changing the default behavior of the YAQL engine?'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2017-06-28 04:21:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Xavier, if these are default values in the YAQL engine then no, let's not change them. I agree with you, we may break someone in productions. If someone needs to change them they'll do it individually."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2017-07-05 07:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Xavier, are you planning to finish this patch?

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 22003, 'date': '2017-07-05 07:42:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

At some point yes, I'm just very busy with other things right now."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-28 05:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-28 05:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-05-30 06:59:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Couple of comments regarding the interoperability issues these options create. Otherwise LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:16:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Andras, thanks for your comments.

Well, I think there's no reason to worry because the defaults are not broken. On the other hand, we already have a case when a customer needs to change some of these options per Mistral installation and they are aware of the consequences."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A customer request was the initial reason for bringing this patch to life again. This patch plus https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570712/ should achieve what they need (plus https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571091/ that adds a small test)'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-05-30 08:01:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with Andras that those break compatibility. I would rather that if we did add those parameters that it prints a warning and we have some log when someone comes back with a weird workflow definition bug we can pinpoint that it using a non standard non supported conf'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-30 08:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Can you please explain how adding these options break compatibility?'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-05-30 08:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Ok. Please add the warning messages before merging. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-30 08:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-05-30 11:09:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Looks good, but can we have a release note?

Wouldn't it make more sense to squash the tests into this patch also?

also not sure about the rally failure?"}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:46:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Dougal, the failure in rally is sporadic, I'm sure about it. Once in a while it happens. As far as the test, it won't pass w/o https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570712. May be I'll need to make the change made in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570712 here, yes. I just noticed that one first and made a commit and then decided to restore this one. Release note, yes, I'll add it.

So, I'll address all of that. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-05-31 06:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Rabbitmq bootstrap enhancement

Using rabbitmq service defined in default when
boot rabbitmq_bootstrap.
Not a bug here, just an enhancement.

Change-Id: I79f0f7efe3308ed4eb898b85a6370be1bd637d9a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 05:29:47.000000000', 'message': 'Run tempest container with host networking

Tempest needs to reach services to perform testing,
currently docker rules are not setup correctly with
containerized undercloud, running tempest with host networking
should workaround this.

Change-Id: Ifb06ffb5b8ca3d6f069a1d55dc46f9fa9a1da3c0
'}]
commit_message:
Run tempest container with host networking

Tempest needs to reach services to perform testing,
currently docker rules are not setup correctly with
containerized undercloud, running tempest with host networking
should workaround this.

Change-Id: Ifb06ffb5b8ca3d6f069a1d55dc46f9fa9a1da3c0

The OpenStack infra are now mirroring the virtualization and cloud

commit_message:
tests: bootstrap-host: Set openSUSE OBS mirror for OpenStack CI

The OpenStack infra are now mirroring the virtualization and cloud
repositories for openSUSE so we don't need to set the OBS mirror
to the official download.opensuse.org anymore.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 20:08:05.000000000', 'message': 'mirror nova host aggregate members to placement

This patch is the first step in syncing the nova host aggregate
information with the placement service. The scheduler report client gets
a couple new public methods -- aggregate_add_host() and
aggregate_remove_host(). Both of these methods do **NOT** impact the
provider tree cache that the scheduler reportclient keeps when
instantiated inside the compute resource tracker.

Instead, these two new reportclient methods look up a resource provider

commit_message:
mirror nova host aggregate members to placement

This patch is the first step in syncing the nova host aggregate
information with the placement service. The scheduler report client gets
a couple new public methods -- aggregate_add_host() and
aggregate_remove_host(). Both of these methods do **NOT** impact the
provider tree cache that the scheduler reportclient keeps when
instantiated inside the compute resource tracker.

Instead, these two new reportclient methods look up a resource provider
by *name* (not UUID) since that is what is supplied by the
os-aggregates Compute API when adding or removing a "host" to/from a
nova host aggregate.

Change-Id: Ibd7aa4f8c4ea787774becece324d9051521c44b6
blueprint: placement-mirror-host-aggregates

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 03:20:16.000000000', 'message': 'actions/ansible: set default timeout to 30s

When running Ansible from a Mistral workflow, the default timeout
is now 30 seconds instead of the default provided by Ansible (12 seconds).
Under heavy load, it can take more than 12 seconds to reach nodes for the
first time. Increasing the timeout will reduce this risk when deploying
TripleO with limited resources.

Change-Id: I42d10ffc421718a75cca18bcdb79c91107f86860
Related-Bug: #1774557
'}]
commit_message:
actions/ansible: set default timeout to 30s

When running Ansible from a Mistral workflow, the default timeout
is now 30 seconds instead of the default provided by Ansible (12 seconds).
Under heavy load, it can take more than 12 seconds to reach nodes for the
first time. Increasing the timeout will reduce this risk when deploying
TripleO with limited resources.

Change-Id: I42d10ffc421718a75cca18bcdb79c91107f86860
Related-Bug: #1774557

commit_message:
Strip underscores from journalbeat fields

Elasticsearch does not index fields starting with underscore,
they are reserved for internal use.

Change-Id: I3575f6ba0628c5ff4125910e34185a4d1526aeb9
