commit_message:
Track neutron-lib migration of agent extensions

The agent extensions code is migrating to neutron-lib.  This change
reflects that migration in neutron.

NeutronLibImpact
- Consumers using the agents extension should now use
the Agent extension API from neutron-lib instead of neutron.

Co-authored-by: Reedip<reedip.banerjee@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ie8f0e70b11435d627f73e3fed45f946e863e90bc
Depends-On: I7255a5ae6b706c09acecc0dea5dbd2febae0c282

subject: Debian: fix redis service setup
messages: [{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2018-05-31 19:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2018-05-31 20:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-01 01:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 19:24:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: redis service debian test

Change-Id: I1b37524ff1071d87e8a7df2fa3bca66aed162d1b
'}, {'created': '2018-05-31 20:44:26.000000000', 'message': 'Debian: fix redis service setup

The redis-server appears as "masked" in the OpenStack CI, even though it
did not in my test VM. As a consequence, "systemctl enable redis-server"
fails, and consequently, the puppet run fails in OpenStack CI. The thing
is, there's no need to enable this service, as in all distros, it's
already enabled by default. Even in the OpenStack CI, the service appears
as enabled, but masked (which by the way, should never happen, as this
isn't a working systemd state).

This patch simply removes the enabling of the systemd service, so that
it also works in Debian in the CI.

Change-Id: I1b37524ff1071d87e8a7df2fa3bca66aed162d1b
'}]
commit_message:
Debian: fix redis service setup

The redis-server appears as "masked" in the OpenStack CI, even though it
did not in my test VM. As a consequence, "systemctl enable redis-server"
fails, and consequently, the puppet run fails in OpenStack CI. The thing
is, there's no need to enable this service, as in all distros, it's
already enabled by default. Even in the OpenStack CI, the service appears
as enabled, but masked (which by the way, should never happen, as this
isn't a working systemd state).

This patch simply removes the enabling of the systemd service, so that
it also works in Debian in the CI.

Change-Id: I1b37524ff1071d87e8a7df2fa3bca66aed162d1b

subject: Fix DB migration on mysql-cluster
messages:
[{'account_id': 27193, 'date': '2018-06-01 11:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-06-01 15:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Wow, thank you for catching this!

However, we need to implement these changes as a new migration, otherwise we will have databases that are already deployed still have the mis-matched sizes and potential problems in the future.

We should be able to create a new migration file and do alter tables to fix these sizing mis-matches.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 11:29:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DB migration on mysql-cluster

Change columns size for foreign key. Columns have same size as
references columns in tables.

Change columns size for foreign key. Columns have same size as
references columns in tables.

[{'created': '2018-05-29 11:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove rally_git_* overrides

Presently, rally in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected,
and the libraries that it pulls in are unconstrained and may cause failure
as has been seen recently with the new release of the cmd2 library which is
python3 only.

This commit removes the  playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml
file as it only contains the rally git overrides. This results in the rally
venv getting installed from PyPI but with upper-constraints applied.

commit_message:
Remove rally_git_* overrides

Presently, rally in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected,
and the libraries that it pulls in are unconstrained and may cause failure
as has been seen recently with the new release of the cmd2 library which is
python3 only.

This commit removes the playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml
file as it only contains the rally git overrides. This results in the rally
venv getting installed from PyPI but with upper-constraints applied.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/570905
Change-Id: I79f37deb3615046e6c944008cc73d5cf2da5bb99

commit_message:
Use geneve mtu for vlan

In core OVN, traffic from vlan (or any other) tenant network
to external network uses a geneve tunnel between the compute
node and the gateway node.
So MTU for the VLAN networks needs to account for geneve tunnel
overhead. Till core OVN is fixed not to use geneve tunnel,
we need to adjust the MTU of the tenant networks.

Closes-bug: #1765691
Change-Id: Ia7bf790f92042beea8dc58cb5bb803303c130ba0

Add ceph minor update step

This change adds the step required for running ceph minor update
with ceph-ansible during the minor update workflow.

Change-Id: I6503f146e31836ed38bf5220149edd73c7f3297a

commit_message:
Remove the TokenAuth middleware

The entire purpose of this confusingly named middleware is to take token
values out of headers and put them into a dictionary. There's no point
in this, we have a request class that can abstract this for us.

Deprecate the middleware, it's unnecessary.

bp: deprecated-as-of-rocky
Change-Id: I09310bab6bd728127288ba4c3cf8f884a31e2b98

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 15:31:56.000000000', 'message': 'scripts: Use ansible_python_interpreter on localhost

Commit 50c7edb9d8c5383303207026d30b4badc0c5f398 ("Only install
libvirt-python and python-lxml via pip") added support for installing
libvirt-python and lxml on the virtualenv but this leads to problem like
the following one when executing all the virt_* modules.

The `libvirt` module is not importable. Check the requirements.

The problem is that libvirt-python and python-lxml are installed in the
virtualenv, but when Ansible operates on localhost, the default
interpreter is /usr/bin/python. As such, it's unable to find the
necessary requirements for all the virt_* Ansible modules. In order to
fix that, we need to pass the correct Ansible python interpreter when
operating on localhost.

Change-Id: I59949b0ff821aac1767f56844082c2e8a32035f6
'}, {'created': '2018-05-21 15:47:47.000000000', 'message': 'scripts: Use ansible_python_interpreter on localhost

virtualenv, but when Ansible operates on localhost, the default

necessary requirements for all the virt_* Ansible modules. In order to
fix that, we need to pass the correct Ansible python interpreter when
operating on localhost. This also requires python-apt to be installed
in the virtualenv as well to avoid the following problem

The `libvirt` module is not importable. Check the requirements.

Since we now pass the venv interp to Ansible, we also need to have

'}]
commit_message:
scripts: Use ansible_python_interpreter on localhost

Commit 50c7edb9d8c5383303207026d30b4badc0c5f398 ("Only install
libvirt-python and python-lxml via pip") added support for installing
libvirt-python and lxml on the virtualenv but this leads to problem like
the following one when executing all the virt_* modules.

The `libvirt` module is not importable. Check the requirements.

The problem is that libvirt-python and python-lxml are installed in the
virtualenv, but when Ansible operates on localhost, the default
interpreter is /usr/bin/python. As such, it's unable to find the
necessary requirements for all the virt_* Ansible modules. In order to
fix that, we need to pass the correct Ansible python interpreter when
operating on localhost.

Since we now pass the venv interp to Ansible, we also need to have
python-apt in the virtualenv in order to be able to use the 'apt'
module. However, in [1] it's clear that python-apt can't be installed in
a virtualenv so we have no other option than switching the ansible
python interpreter back to the host one for the tasks which need the
'apt' module.

fatal: [127.0.0.1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Could not
import python modules: apt, apt_pkg. Please install python-apt
package."}

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/14468
Change-Id: I59949b0ff821aac1767f56844082c2e8a32035f6

commit_message:
Mount /var/run/redis for the redis socket

Under pacemaker, it manages this mount correctly. When not deploying
redis with pacemaker, the /var/run/redis folder is not properly mounted
so the container cannot start correctly after a reboot.

Change-Id: I1b86bc91e7ca95a1e70fecee1b6507787d98e9cd
Closes-Bug: #1771888

messages:
[{'account_id': 28359, 'date': '2018-05-30 09:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-30 09:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
libvirt:  add vf_trusted field for network metadata

This add the vf_trusted field for network metadata. Currently only
libvirt is supporting it.

Implements blueprint bp/sriov-trusted-vfs
Change-Id: I4aa2786cfa95b923078679a398bdfe4de622be57
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove os-testr from lower-constraints

As neutron-lib is now switched to use stestr to run tests,
os-testr package is not needed in requirements anymore.

Change-Id: I9f62d3d9525af8d5b38b15f6c134435d4d985acd

[{'created': '2018-05-24 12:29:08.000000000', 'message': "tasks: Fix permissions for /var/log directory

The files/50-defaults.conf file configures some facilities and
priorities to be logged into the /var/log directory but the role
doesn't properly configure the permissions on it so rsyslog may
not be able to write anything to that directory.

Change-Id: I15478ca348a3a399f20b54ee130ce017e8d03551
"}]
commit_message:
tasks: Fix permissions for /var/log directory

The files/50-defaults.conf file configures some facilities and
priorities to be logged into the /var/log directory but the role
doesn't properly configure the permissions on it so rsyslog may
not be able to write anything to that directory.

Change-Id: I15478ca348a3a399f20b54ee130ce017e8d03551

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-24 12:24:08.000000000', 'message': "templates: Fix group for rsyslog daemon

The role is creating the 'adm' group for the rsyslog user but the
template was using the 'syslog' group.

Change-Id: I1dee3b0554ca6a7f96fab720d834daf55b9c4dd7
"}]
commit_message:
templates: Fix group for rsyslog daemon

The role is creating the 'adm' group for the rsyslog user but the
template was using the 'syslog' group.

Change-Id: I1dee3b0554ca6a7f96fab720d834daf55b9c4dd7

commit_message:
scripts: bootstrap-ansible.sh: Bump SHA for Ansible 2.4

Ansible stable-2.4 branch contains a fix[1] for zypper which massively
improves its performance when installing packages. It's beneficial to
have that until we move to 2.5 in order to improve the gate times.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/608d30ba9b989b5474c8cd9b537eaeac9bafc544

Change-Id: Iad28b2943b7c3041fc800ff1b1a7f4aeca7a315a

[{'created': '2018-05-29 16:54:25.000000000', 'message': "use get reader/writer session from neutron-lib

The get_reader_session and get_writer_session functions are available
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes them by removing the functions
from neutron and using lib's instead in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570603

Change-Id: I1c5441ace46da0d4bc08afb89c44d8e5778dcacf
"}]
commit_message:
use get reader/writer session from neutron-lib

The get_reader_session and get_writer_session functions are available
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes them by removing the functions
from neutron and using lib's instead in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570603

Change-Id: I1c5441ace46da0d4bc08afb89c44d8e5778dcacf

commit_message:
Optimized Ansible tasks in deplay-steps-tasks.yaml

- do not use set_fact when a lookup can be done directly in the task
- use multi-line YAML for easier legibility
- ignore errors in file lookup plugin when file does not exist and set defaults

Change-Id: I832a2ec34f4ed4a87e30d0c88f4c60bcf2f4c151

commit_message:
Annotate sort_key parameters for all resources

Add a 'is_sort_key' keyword for each attribute that can
be used as a sort_key. In the future, we will rely on this keyword
to perform validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

This patch processes the following resources: ports, segments,
trunks, address scopes, floating IPs, routers, subnetpools,
subnets, flavors, logging, metering, qos related resources.

Note: This patch only processes the attributes that are documented
as sort_key in api-ref.

Change-Id: I936378855ba43bd7dfdb25a5e324a4bd3e21345d
Related-Bug: #1749820

Add a 'is_filter' keyword for each resource's attribute that can be
used as filter. In the future, we will rely on this to perform
filter validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

This patch processes the following resources: ports, segments,
trunks, address scopes, floating IPs, routers, subnetpools,
subnets, agents, availability zones, flavors, log, metering,
qos related resources.

Note: This patch processes the attributes that are documented
as filter parameter in api-ref.

Change-Id: I595b27a83fb2c185a4889030d619ce4d877fa881
Related-Bug: #1749820

commit_message:
Annotate filter parameters for all resources

Add a 'is_filter' keyword for each resource's attribute that can be
used as filter. In the future, we will rely on this to perform
filter validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

This patch processes the following resources: ports, segments,
trunks, address scopes, floating IPs, routers, subnetpools,
subnets, agents, availability zones, flavors, log, metering,
qos related resources.

Note: This patch processes the attributes that are documented
as filter parameter in api-ref.

Change-Id: I595b27a83fb2c185a4889030d619ce4d877fa881
Related-Bug: #1749820

commit_message:
test-ansible-deps: Bump SHA for Ansible 2.4

Ansible stable-2.4 branch contains a fix[1] for zypper which massively
improves its performance when installing packages. It's beneficial to
have that until we move to 2.5 in order to improve the gate times.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/608d30ba9b989b5474c8cd9b537eaeac9bafc544

Change-Id: I5198190d42f655eeba3cbe82b0388de8c4f81ba9

 > [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1757513
 > [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562320/
 > [3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558318/

I re-tested it and I saw the 'description' is 'null'. I think you are right that the stdattr description is still not used.

However, I saw another patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562345/) has landed at OSC for checking 'standard-attr-segment' extension to decide the value of description field, and I did remember that patch fixed the gate at that time.

I guess there might be some randomness based on the loading order of the extensions. Regardless of the issue, I think we can go ahead and remove the old 'description' field for now since we already have an extension 'standard-attr-segment' to indicate this change."}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-05-29 22:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-05-29 22:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

sorry John I am driving you nuts with this but after talking on IRC it seems best to pass stack_name from parent to make sure it includes always and only the first parts "overcloud".

you should add it as param into deploy-steps.j2 and pass the value to it from overcloud.j2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-05-28 16:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > (1 comment)
 > you should add it as param into deploy-steps.j2 and pass the value
 > to it from overcloud.j2

I don't understand exactly what you mean. I have the following:

 heat_stack_name: { get_param: 'OS::stack_name' }

It returns "overcloud-AllNodesDeploySteps-5ra7h5vhklbu" during CREATE and UPDATE in my testing so far (we expect 5ra7h5vhklbu to change in different stacks though it seems consistent in the same stack over time). If our goal is to set heat_stack_name to "overcloud", or whatever the user passes with the --stack option to the tripleo client (and only that), then how do you want to get this done with the above line? 

Is there something else I can get_param of OR should I do my string manipulation (e.g. yaql) here in THT and not the workflow? 

I.e. should I work ".split('-')[0]" into the get_param above with HOT's yaql option? 

https://docs.openstack.org/heat/queens/template_guide/hot_spec.html#yaql'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-05-28 16:05:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'll try doing this 100% in HOT but let me know if you have something else in mind. thanks.

commit_message:
Add stack name to env() for OS::TripleO::WorkflowSteps

In I4b576a6e7fbfb18fa13221e2d080bf7876a8303e state information
will be persisted in Swift and the name of the Swift container
should be a function of the Heat stack in case multiple stacks
are deployed. This patch passes the name of the Heat stack to
the Mistral environment so that the workflow may access the
Heat stack name and name the Swift container accordingly.

Change-Id: I995ad32345a39238ffb9cbcf9966dedc60c75ff8
Related-Bug: #1769769

commit_message:
Change ovs release used to compile kernel module for tests node

In some test jobs, like fullstack and ovsfw-scenario job
openvswitch kernel module is compiled from source before tests.
This compilation was failing because of new kernel 4.4.0-127 provided
by Ubuntu.

Kernel module will be compiled from source which contains
fix for this change in kernel.
See related openvswitch commit message for details:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/138df3e563de9da0e5a4155b3534a69621495742

As current Ubuntu uses ovs 2.9.0 we don't need to compile ovs for
ovsfw-scenario-job anymore because fix we needed is already contained
in ovs 2.9.0.

Change-Id: Idc34776e5b2fad105e246f7718220c23f0a94164
Closes-bug: #1772689

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 02:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up property names in case of mixed case hostnames

When deploying a stack that containes mixed-case hostnames
the following error might be triggered:
Debug: try 15/20: /usr/sbin/pcs -f
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20180405-8-1sqw3dc property set
--node TEST-STACK34-controller-1 redis-role=true
Debug: Error: Error: unable to set attribute redis-role
Could not map name=TEST-STACK34-controller-1 to a UUID
while the name in the cluster is test-stack34-controller-1

This used to work pre-bundles because we used the facter provided
$::hostname variable which was lower-cased for us. With bundles we
switched to setting cluster properties from the service bootstrap nodes
and so we used the '<service>_short_node_names' hiera key which might
contain mixed-case hostnames.

In order to fix this we just downcase() the short_node_names hiera
string that we loop on so we can get the same behaviour we had on bare
metal.

Tested on an env with mixed-case hostnames:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml rabbitmq_short_node_names
["UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-0",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-1",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-2"]

Cluster pcs properties were set correctly:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# pcs property |grep rabbitmq
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-0: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-1: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-1
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-2: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-2

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ie240b8a4217827dd8ade82479a828817d63143ba
Closes-bug: #1773219
Change-Id: I5bd49c4a1b13b2310f8a1173aa6b86abfa5dab3d
(cherry picked from commit f2484a0bf9e64ff84979abe9b70e7f65957b9d26)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up property names in case of mixed case hostnames

When deploying a stack that containes mixed-case hostnames
the following error might be triggered:
Debug: try 15/20: /usr/sbin/pcs -f
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20180405-8-1sqw3dc property set
--node TEST-STACK34-controller-1 redis-role=true
Debug: Error: Error: unable to set attribute redis-role
Could not map name=TEST-STACK34-controller-1 to a UUID
while the name in the cluster is test-stack34-controller-1

This used to work pre-bundles because we used the facter provided
$::hostname variable which was lower-cased for us. With bundles we
switched to setting cluster properties from the service bootstrap nodes
and so we used the '<service>_short_node_names' hiera key which might
contain mixed-case hostnames.

In order to fix this we just downcase() the short_node_names hiera
string that we loop on so we can get the same behaviour we had on bare
metal.

Tested on an env with mixed-case hostnames:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml rabbitmq_short_node_names
["UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-0",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-1",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-2"]

Cluster pcs properties were set correctly:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# pcs property |grep rabbitmq
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-0: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-1: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-1
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-2: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-2

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ie240b8a4217827dd8ade82479a828817d63143ba
Closes-bug: #1773219
Change-Id: I5bd49c4a1b13b2310f8a1173aa6b86abfa5dab3d
(cherry picked from commit f2484a0bf9e64ff84979abe9b70e7f65957b9d26)

commit_message:
Do not log passwords (part 2)

In part [1] some tasks were missed due to the difference
in the tasks between series. This patch fills the gap.

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562986

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571406
Change-Id: I3f7137e4344a401d578dd9d3f987806c5a015b02

commit_message:
Handle empty token key files

In some rare cases, an empty key file can get created within the fernet
key repository. When keystone tries to load the keys from disk, it will
fail with an invalid fernet key ValueError.

This change adds a check for empty files with a valid numerical name
within the key repository when rotating keys and loading keys. If an
empty file exists, it will be ignored when loading keys, reported in the
logs, and overwritten with a valid key upon rotation.

Change-Id: Ic19dd02d38e8f6a05c8951ec3dd13659aab98259
Closes-Bug: 1728907

commit_message:
tests: Pin sahara-tests repo to ~Queens

The 0.6.0 tag on the repo seems to relate approximately
to the Queens release date, so we pin the repo there to
ensure that the tests continue to work ad infinitum.

Change-Id: I5da2ffcd4d4f330778707b2edd639089559ed778

commit_message:
[WIP]Octavia chart for OpenStack Helm

As far as I am aware, the services are up and running, but this has not been
tested. We need an image to test with.

Implements: blueprint octavia-helm-chart
Change-Id: Ia203932e704a28c81064434f7772383aeaf488bc

[{'created': '2018-01-25 11:49:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds eventlet sleep before monkey patch to workaround
this issue.

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013
'}, {'created': '2018-01-25 15:53:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds workaround solution ported from eventlet patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013
'}]
commit_message:
Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds workaround solution ported from eventlet patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013

commit_message:
Comment tempest_git_repo role default

This commit comments out the default for tempest_git_repo so that we
can install tempest from PyPi, but with constraints applied. This was
attempted in [1] but wasn't enough to achieve this outcome. Note that
this change also requires an update to the repo_build role [2] for it
to fully work.

[1] I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595
[2] I4468092eb5c86d6346a793ba1e2bfc6e772de3bb

Change-Id: I05f88153e522b55e619b4d2e2cdfd311ab8228d8
(cherry picked from commit db6a3e0af6748951a47faacdd976bcf09c058ce6)

commit_message:
tests: Pin sahara-tests repo to ~Ocata

The 0.4.0 tag on the repo seems to relate approximately
to the Ocata release date, then there was a patch version
increment to 0.4.1. We pin the repo there to ensure that
the tests continue to work ad infinitum.

Change-Id: I5da2ffcd4d4f330778707b2edd639089559ed778

[{'created': '2018-03-15 17:19:00.000000000', 'message': "tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
"}, {'created': '2018-03-15 21:52:19.000000000', 'message': "tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and

without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209
"}]
commit_message:
tests: port test_port_presence_prevents_network_rbac_policy_deletion

The test was originally implemented in this form as a tempest api test
case, but there is a problem with it being part of tempest suite,
because the suite should be safe to execute on a running cloud and
shouldn't affect other tenants. But sharing a network with everyone (*)
briefly impacts other tenants because they see a new shared network
popping up for a second in their net-list. It is also an issue because
if we are unlucky enough, some other tenant may start an instance
without specifying a particular port or network to use, in which case
there is a chance that nova allocates a port in this shared network and
attach it to the instance. When the rbac test case then tries to delete
the policy and the network, it fails because it's still in use.

The solution is to stop testing this scenario in tempest suite, instead
moving it into unit test suite.

A follow-up patch in neutron-tempest-plugin will clean up the bad test
case.

Change-Id: I199f639c95e8ae884ede46404370d7b64da3b309
Needed-By: Iba89a53b2715cf3a9c7485f2089f27d547fea308
Related-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Avoid potential problems using "| bool"

Making sure that the evaluated variable is a boolean makes the code
clearer and avoids potential problems, for example, if the variable
is defined as false with lower f (false instead of False)

Change-Id: Ia07f52c8581f5373702fd318a4ef052de95c905f
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 08:27:57.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
"}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337

commit_message:
Document branch support policy for extended maint branches

This commit adds a note to the documentation to clarify which branches
tempest will support under the new extended maintenance stable branch
policy. The previous policy of supporting all active branches will not
scale under the new policy as we do not have enough resources to gate
all propsed changes against more than 3 stable branches at a time. With
the addition of this to the documentation we'll clearly define what
branches are in scope for testing of tempest and how/when we should
handle dropping support for a branch.

Change-Id: Ide6dc56b8d37daf6fb26d6a2f20dbf61f06c0998

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated lines

In case where /etc/network/interfaces already contains a similar
line, it is superseeded.

Change-Id: I38f244d093e002f8bc90412c1eacd254ffe31514
(cherry picked from commit 42d14389b023611f8b624b5a82347a9cc39c5cb7)

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated lines

In case where /etc/network/interfaces already contains a similar
line, it is superseeded.

Change-Id: I38f244d093e002f8bc90412c1eacd254ffe31514
(cherry picked from commit 42d14389b023611f8b624b5a82347a9cc39c5cb7)

commit_message:
Verify diff stat is unchanged when syncing only shard ranges

Add test assertions to verify that the related change fixes usync diff
stats being erroneously incremented as a side-effect of syncing shard
ranges when the object tables are in sync.

Related-Change: I2630bb127841837b35e7786b59895fa50090719b
Change-Id: Idffe93c63d16e74ea9ca42b33a636c0c0d9e35b5

subject: Make provisioning workload physical network configurable
messages:
[{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-05-31 11:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-05-31 12:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am not that familiar with neutron. Do we also need support in kolla-ansible for provider mappings? For example here: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf.ini.j2#L80'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-05-31 13:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> I am not that familiar with neutron. Do we also need support in
 > kolla-ansible for provider mappings? For example here:
 > https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf.ini.j2#L80

Kolla assumes the use of physnet$N for each of the bridges in neutron_bridge_names (which is derived from the bridge interfaces for networks in external_net_names in kayobe). Getting this physnet mapping right when that is not the case would be a nice addition to kolla/kayobe, but can always be configured manually by overriding the option in an ml2_conf.ini custom config file.'}]

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I96ff4b5ef3da32c07c01a9378fac5c34503fa08d
'}]
commit_message:
Make provisioning workload physical network configurable

The provider_physical_network, as passed to neutron, can
now be configured with the physical_network attribute on
workload provisioning network.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I96ff4b5ef3da32c07c01a9378fac5c34503fa08d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 19:25:16.000000000', 'message': "Add default dns_server option in DHCP_Options table

If a subnet is not defined with dns_nameservers option, then networking-ovn
doesn't add any default 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option in the DHCP_Options table.

This patch addresses this issue by
 - Introducing a config option - 'dns_servers' similar to 'dnsmasq_dns_servers'
   config option supported by dhcp agent and uses it as the 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option
   in the DHCP_Options table.

 - If the 'dns_servers' option is not defined, then it uses the system dns resolvers
   from the /etc/resolv.conf.

Closes-bug: #1774052
Change-Id: Ibf6396232f8eac780baa676b0b8395082d5c3527
"}, {'created': '2018-05-30 18:48:03.000000000', 'message': "Add default dns_server option in DHCP_Options table

commit_message:
Add default dns_server option in DHCP_Options table

If a subnet is not defined with dns_nameservers option, then networking-ovn
doesn't add any default 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option in the DHCP_Options table.

This patch addresses this issue by
 - Introducing a config option - 'dns_servers' similar to 'dnsmasq_dns_servers'
   config option supported by dhcp agent and uses it as the 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option
   in the DHCP_Options table.

 - If the 'dns_servers' option is not defined, then it uses the system dns resolvers
   from the /etc/resolv.conf.

Closes-bug: #1774052
Change-Id: Ibf6396232f8eac780baa676b0b8395082d5c3527

commit_message:
use get reader/writer session from neutron-lib

The get_reader_session and get_writer_session functions are available
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes them by removing the functions
from neutron and using lib's instead in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570603

Change-Id: If925580554fdf50afac6ec41e68a38a6d348aae7

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for mistral

Provide support for kolla dev mode in mistral. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'mistral_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of mistral project is cloned
and bind mounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I6e5f9b1a6b35dbb672905987e715cae4bf10af7f

subject: Don't recurse when creating bind mount directories
messages: [{'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-05-31 23:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-01 05:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 23:29:30.000000000', 'message': "Don't recurse when creating bind mount directories

The 'Ensure bind mount host directories exists' task does not provide
any attributes so recursing is unnecessary. If a parent directory does
not exist, Ansible will automatically create it.

Change-Id: Ia71518e87362c52b849b1baac5a7e17f86e83865
"}]
commit_message:
Don't recurse when creating bind mount directories

The 'Ensure bind mount host directories exists' task does not provide
any attributes so recursing is unnecessary. If a parent directory does
not exist, Ansible will automatically create it.

Change-Id: Ia71518e87362c52b849b1baac5a7e17f86e83865

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-19 05:04:55.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Testing using a common SystemD init role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
attempts to leverage a common systemd service role which could be
maintained out of tree.

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed. The exterior role is built to be OSA compatible and may be pulled
into tree should we deem it necessary.

Change-Id: I44c6b656c02d60fde97fcaac6bc4fd8a7388cba1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-28 12:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'change triircle endpoint creation adjust to keystone

1. What is the problem?
Keystone in Openstack devstack Master changed api for endpoint creation
while tricircle plugin present remains the old way

2. What is the solution to the problem?
change the service create to "openstack endpoint create name type"

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
installation for tricircle

Change-Id: Ic212f909cd27be232cae38b845f6d5e66dec998b

commit_message:
change trircle endpoint creation method adjust to keystone api

1. What is the problem?
Keystone in Openstack devstack Master changed api for endpoint creation
while tricircle plugin present remains the old way

2. What is the solution to the problem?
change the service create to "openstack endpoint create name type"

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
installation for tricircle

Change-Id: Ic212f909cd27be232cae38b845f6d5e66dec998b

commit_message:
Execute multiple events at once

Currently, the blazar manager executes only one event per 10 seconds.
This patch enables the blazar manager to execute multiple events at one
time.

Change-Id: I3ea7313b3bb36584a872a747abd6da4bd43020ac
Closes-Bug: #1747560

commit_message:
Move BUILD_ID setting logic out of template

This makes the template simpler, and refactors in preperation for
referring to container_build_id from another template.

Change-Id: Ia19f8fdc9705f43ddf0497fab3279c1ee33c696c
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Expose option to delete 'unused rpms'

There is an option to remove package, if the service is being disabled
 during upgrade.
Default value remains 'false'.

Change-Id: Ide7966272e54f02d4fcb427b92bc853351018380
Depends-On: I7bad96be0c3dfc1e605efe9d504249dc9045d71d

commit_message:
Unset UpgradeRemoveUnusedPackages on converge.

There is an option to remove package, if the service is being
disabled during upgrade. This option should be unset when running
'overcloud upgrade converge'.

Change-Id: I7bad96be0c3dfc1e605efe9d504249dc9045d71d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 09:13:50.000000000', 'message': 'Write docker_puppet_tasks to bootstrap node

docker_puppet_tasks is meant to only run on the bootstrap node. So we
enforce writing these tasks from every role to the primary role only.
Eventually, only the first node from the primary role will be the
bootstrap node, which is where we want these tasks executed.

Closes-Bug: #1767972
Change-Id: Ia3492a72200219e8f20490f2e22a2b466ea2bb57
'}]
commit_message:
Write docker_puppet_tasks to bootstrap node

docker_puppet_tasks is meant to only run on the bootstrap node. So we
enforce writing these tasks from every role to the primary role only.
Eventually, only the first node from the primary role will be the
bootstrap node, which is where we want these tasks executed.

Closes-Bug: #1767972
Change-Id: Ia3492a72200219e8f20490f2e22a2b466ea2bb57

commit_message:
Support resource_properties key in instance reservation

This patch adds a 'resource_properties' key for instance reservation as
a required parameter. If a user specifies the key when they create
instance reservations, Blazar picks up hypervisors that match the key
for the reservation.

Partially Implements: blueprint flavors-extra-specs
Change-Id: Ia8877c667116739d75381776555f91e529c1c21d

commit_message:
Replace deprecated "auth_uri" by "www_authenticate_uri"

According to [1], "auth_uri" has been deprecated.
This patch replace it by using "www_authenticate_uri" instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 07:11:30.000000000', 'message': "Add internal-client config integration for Swift

Current devstack is missing the configuration of internal-client
that is used by Swift background processes. Though almost of the processes
doesn't require the configuration (hopefully it's better to be located, tho)
but the new background daemon called container sharder does.

Then, the missing configuration causes failure return code 1 at swift-init
that causes unfortunate gate failure if devstack is used to setup Swift
in the gerrit gate. (See related bug report in detail)

This patch attempts to setup the as-is internal-client configuration from
Swift's example configuration dir, that will work almost cases except user
customized devstack.

Change-Id: I350ebdf7f79c7d27d77469b2bc3fd09486dca411
Closes-Bug: #1774343
"}]
commit_message:
Add internal-client config integration for Swift

Current devstack is missing the configuration of internal-client
that is used by Swift background processes. Though almost of the processes
doesn't require the configuration (hopefully it's better to be located, tho)
but the new background daemon called container sharder does.

Then, the missing configuration causes failure return code 1 at swift-init
that causes unfortunate gate failure if devstack is used to setup Swift
in the gerrit gate. (See related bug report in detail)

This patch attempts to setup the as-is internal-client configuration from
Swift's example configuration dir, that will work almost cases except user
customized devstack.

Change-Id: I350ebdf7f79c7d27d77469b2bc3fd09486dca411
Closes-Bug: #1774343

subject: load neutron objects using neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-24 21:42:58.000000000', 'message': "load neutron objects using neutron-lib

To access neutron objects we're moving to a dynamic plugin approach as
shown in the depends on and related patches.

This patch removes the imports of neutron.objects and uses neutron-lib
to load them instead. The remaining base object import will be addressed
later.

It also bumps neutron-lib up to 1.14.0.

Change-Id: Ia0904a2c97749fb13604a44fee3c96c40588e0b2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570060/
"}]
commit_message:
load neutron objects using neutron-lib

To access neutron objects we're moving to a dynamic plugin approach as
shown in the depends on and related patches.

This patch removes the imports of neutron.objects and uses neutron-lib
to load them instead. The remaining base object import will be addressed
later.

It also bumps neutron-lib up to 1.14.0.

Change-Id: Ia0904a2c97749fb13604a44fee3c96c40588e0b2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570060/

commit_message:
Replace db_api with sql query in migration script

The db migration scripts are executed one by one. On the other
hands, db_api always expects the up-to-date DB schema is defined
in the Blazar DB. If db_api methods are executed in the middle
of db migrations, the mis-match between the real schema and model
definition causes migration error.

This patch replaces db_api methods in migration scripts with
sql queries. It prevents migration scrpits from the error.

Change-Id: I0509b9c7dadd2df5e70360fe4673f8a71a4c5f3a
Closes-Bug: #1757076

commit_message:
Sort image list by name when launch instance

Just like the flavor sort issue, this is another regression issue
when we shift from the legacy launch instance wizard. By default,
the image list should be ordered by name.

Change-Id: Id619ad531f7e91326694ee90c112d6a7db0d14ad

messages:
[{'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2018-05-31 22:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-31 22:24:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-31 22:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This appears to be largely a derivative of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566381/14/doc/source/troubleshooting/ceph.rst

commit_message:
Update default configuration values related to Keystone

As of the Queens release, Keystone support for Identity API v2.0 has
been removed [1]. This patch updates default configuration values to
reflect this change.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/contributor/http-api.html

Change-Id: I4b717e60e501ce749cae56a868fd50cefb175a9c

'}, {'created': '2018-04-25 01:19:13.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce oslo.messaging and sync rpc call

Adds oslo.messaging to ironic-inspector, and convert

commit_message:
Introduce oslo.messaging and sync rpc call

Adds oslo.messaging to ironic-inspector, and convert
inspect, abort and reapply to synchronized rpc calls.

This is the first step of API and worker seperation.

Change-Id: I15e86d7feb623b6b2889891b9700e5de6b3164cd
Story: #2001842
Task: # 12609

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 09:49:49.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Hacking is not in g-r, and the 1.1.0 release brought in updates to one
of its dependencies, pycodestyle.

This change both fixes the 3 new style errors, and introduces an uppper
limit of 1.1.x to hacking to prevent breakage from future minor version
updates.

Change-Id: I523398a0699f99233d095e551082036f0bf174b3

commit_message:
upgrade: remove packages at step 3

This is for the upgrade of the undercloud from Queens to Rocky.
Removing packages at step 2 causes problem when ansible tries to see if
service is running at the same step, so we really want to do the cleanup
later, at step 3 which is probably safer. Note that at the end of step3,
we upgrade all rpms, so we won't loose time on upgrading the one we
would have to remove later.

Related-Bug: 1772804
Change-Id: I02697c6b503f8ef83e3440ec5249e95668f2749d

I'm looking at this build and comparing to the current docs at https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/queens/contributor/developing.html and don't see a difference, am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:12:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think there's a problem in the format."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-31 14:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

tianhui wrote:

> > I'm looking at this build and comparing to the current docs at
 > https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/queens/contributor/developing.html
 > and don't see a difference, am I missing something?
>
> I think there's a problem in the format.

This is actually not a mistake.

Sphinx "code-block" directive does not necessarily require the indent level of code block matches the level of code-block directive, so it works fine. If there is no way to prevent future same situation, I tend to agree with Steve.'}, {'account_id': 26311, 'date': '2018-06-01 01:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Function Aliases spec proposal
messages:
[{'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-16 05:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-16 06:38:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nice! I'll put it on top of my review list, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-17 08:37:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

guys, FYI, i am preparing the summit slices these days and will attend openstack summit during next week, I'm sorry for any potential delay for the patch review."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-22 16:29:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

After looking at the spec, i have some suggestions:

- I'd like the 'alias' to be the first class resource in qinling, so end user doesn't even need to remember the function id by using `/v1/aliases/<name>`, the 'name' must be unique within the tenant.
- From the spec, i cannot see how `routing_config` is used, could you please elaborate more?
- Also, the relationship between the alias and the function, job, webhook etc is missing in the spec."}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-23 02:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-23 02:50:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> After looking at the spec, i have some suggestions:
 > 
 > - I'd like the 'alias' to be the first class resource in qinling,
 > so end user doesn't even need to remember the function id by using
 > `/v1/aliases/<name>`, the 'name' must be unique within the tenant.
 > - From the spec, i cannot see how `routing_config` is used, could
 > you please elaborate more?
 > - Also, the relationship between the alias and the function, job,
 > webhook etc is missing in the spec.

Thanks for the suggestions, for the relationship between the alias and function, job webhook， I need to discuss more with you, i have some confuse here, from the AWS Lambda, alias is a pointer to the specific function version, I am not full understand the relationship with job and webhook in qinling"}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-23 02:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-24 04:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> some confuse here, from the AWS Lambda, alias is a pointer to the
 > specific function version, I am not full understand the
 > relationship with job and webhook in qinling

Currently, we could specify the function and the version number when creating either job or webhook. With alias implemented, we also need to support alias in job/webhook.'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-25 08:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-29 02:32:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Hi, you didn't answer my first 2 questions in patchset 1"}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-29 02:51:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Hi, you didn't answer my first 2 questions in patchset 1
For first question, you mean the 'alias' should be the same level resource of 'function' right? Sorry, I misunderstand here, I will update it.
For question 2 I have add the explanation under the create alias api."}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-29 03:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-29 19:09:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

The implementation of function alias looks very easy, but actually, it's not. Please take more consideration for every detail(although it's not necessary to mention them all in the spec)"}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-30 05:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-30 05:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(10 comments)

Yes, I try to include more details into the spec.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-30 10:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-31 01:57:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-05-31 03:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-31 05:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Again, when I was thinking about this feature, there are much more details we need to look after, the implementation is not as easy as how we think it is. So pay attention to how each current API will be affected by the alias feature.'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-31 06:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-31 06:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-05-31 22:06:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Most of my concerns are included, we could get started for the implementation :-)'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-06-01 01:27:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's move forward"}]

commit_message:
Fix warnings in documentation

A recent change defaults the warning-as-error to True:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559348/

Which is causing our documentation jobs to fail locally and in the
gate/check queues.

This commit fixes both issues that are causing failures so that
we can get the doc jobs passing again.

Closes-Bug: 1774508
Change-Id: Ic1eff48a6f40aa315cc5e566a0f9e930a20b9837

Fix readme doc

Recent changes to pypi prevent uploading if the rst has issues.

$ python setup.py check -r -s
running check
warning: check: Title underline too short. (line 42)

warning: check: Title underline too short. (line 42)

error: Please correct your package.

Change-Id: Ia1e014cce3e95ccd065395775370d6c29572466f
Related-Bug: #1774001

commit_message:
Remove cloud-init and disable os-collect-config

A user uses a guest image for the undercloud, cloud-init may be
installed which can also cause other services like os-collect-config to
be running. We should ensure that cloud-init is removed and that the
os-collect-config service is disable to prevent it from interfering with
overcloud deployments.

Change-Id: I58f6fc4b299c8f1f561205ac9a2de75c46467ba8
Closes-Bug: #1754426
Closes-Bug: #1774079
(cherry picked from commit 998230da5cb6c0b725b8e67c82bf2157b9f0c46b)
(cherry picked from commit c95254293b8068057c42ddae8b45eadec87c5f70)

commit_message:
Add basics for standalone node

For a standalone all-in-one, we need to create a basic role that has
some of the services, a network config for a single node and an
environment file that has all the services defined but disabled so
that we can enable just the services we will need. In the future, we
will likely make the service list more dynamic but for now it contains a
minimal set of services for a keystone/openshift/kubernetes deployment.

Change-Id: Ieb7c94563bd0132393b5fa268d743981f6e0b6f2
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

An OSA password needs to end with _password

This means we need to rename our cert client password.

commit_message:
Remove unused option enable_container_images_build

This option was added in change
I5cf5798cd084d99a3c892daab6db444d1e608beb but was never actually wired
in to do anything.

Since we now have such comprehensive image build pipelines, I think it
is better to removed this unused option rather than wire it in.

Change-Id: I20f67d8b1bbeb8b768777a41b5d33c819192ea2d

Luminous can assign application types to pools and ceph-ansible
supports this, provided it is passed an appropriate list of maps.
The list of maps is defined in openstack_pools and this change
updates this variable to contain the correct default application
type.

Includes update to environments/disable-telemetry.yaml so that
the GnocchiRbdPool is not created if telemetry is disabled.

Change-Id: I3966a8a1b170202e020684a36ecece78599296b5
Closes-Bug: #1772743
(cherry picked from commit 959cb6c5391bae657113ec6f69abe1a7cc277ee5)
'}]
commit_message:
Set default application for Ceph Luminous openstack_pools

Luminous can assign application types to pools and ceph-ansible
supports this, provided it is passed an appropriate list of maps.
The list of maps is defined in openstack_pools and this change
updates this variable to contain the correct default application
type.

Includes update to environments/disable-telemetry.yaml so that
the GnocchiRbdPool is not created if telemetry is disabled.

Change-Id: I3966a8a1b170202e020684a36ecece78599296b5
Closes-Bug: #1772743
(cherry picked from commit 959cb6c5391bae657113ec6f69abe1a7cc277ee5)

commit_message:
Add validation for checking node counts

This validation checks that available nodes is sufficient for what is
requested.

Change-Id: I1f3266275c39e093ddae18f93185eff3e4f74675
Implements: blueprint workflow-move-validations
Closes-Bug: #1632704

Drop old ceilometer services

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-20 23:51:55.000000000', 'message': "Use a dedicated prepare command for container-check

containers_update.yaml needs to exclude ceph, and later changes in
this series will create a overcloud_containers.yaml file which
container-check can't consume, or later in the series there will be no
overcloud_containers.yaml file generated at all.

To deal with this, run a dedicated prepare call to generate the
required containers_update.yaml.

Change-Id: Id44eda339eb674339a0e6105079449e113de542c
"}, {'created': '2018-05-21 04:08:00.000000000', 'message': "Use a dedicated prepare command for container-check

To deal with this, run a dedicated prepare call to generate the

This change also removes the logic which renames the base os repo
files to disable them. Since change

commit_message:
Use a dedicated prepare command for container-check

containers_update.yaml needs to exclude ceph, and later changes in
this series will create a overcloud_containers.yaml file which
container-check can't consume, or later in the series there will be no
overcloud_containers.yaml file generated at all.

To deal with this, run a dedicated prepare call to generate the
required containers_update.yaml.

This change also removes the logic which renames the base os repo
files to disable them. Since change
I764bc9a368e63a9aa82ec5503bcd3a9c7c6f4e25 there is now a
packages_for_update variable populated, which will speed updates and
ensure that only the packages being tested (and their dependencies
which may come from a base repo) will be updated

Change-Id: Id44eda339eb674339a0e6105079449e113de542c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 01:48:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix suffix-byte-range responses for zero-byte EC objects.

The object servers are correctly returning 200s for such objects, but
we were misinterpreting the result in the proxy. We had assumed that a
satisfiable byte-range contained at least one byte, which seems
reasonable unless you gaze long into RFC 7233.

Suffix byte ranges (e.g. "bytes=-32123") are not asking for the last N
bytes of an object; they are asking for *up to* the last N bytes, or
the whole thing if fewer than N bytes are available. In the EC
machinery, we had code that assumed "has no bytes" == "unsatisfiable",
which is not true in that specific case. Now we correctly handle a
suffix-byte-range request that is satisfiable but receives zero bytes.

Change-Id: I8295a6c1436f50f86a4c626d87de6bfedd74ab09
Closes-Bug: 1736840
'}, {'created': '2018-02-26 12:18:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix suffix-byte-range responses for zero-byte EC objects.

The object servers are correctly returning 200s for such objects, but
we were misinterpreting the result in the proxy. We had assumed that a
satisfiable byte-range contained at least one byte, which seems
reasonable unless you gaze long into RFC 7233.

Suffix byte ranges (e.g. "bytes=-32123") are not asking for the last N
bytes of an object; they are asking for *up to* the last N bytes, or
the whole thing if fewer than N bytes are available. In the EC
machinery, we had code that assumed "has no bytes" == "unsatisfiable",
which is not true in that specific case. Now we correctly handle a
suffix-byte-range request that is satisfiable but receives zero bytes.

Change-Id: I8295a6c1436f50f86a4c626d87de6bfedd74ab09
Closes-Bug: 1736840
'}]
commit_message:
Fix suffix-byte-range responses for zero-byte EC objects.

The object servers are correctly returning 200s for such objects, but
we were misinterpreting the result in the proxy. We had assumed that a
satisfiable byte-range contained at least one byte, which seems
reasonable unless you gaze long into RFC 7233.

Suffix byte ranges (e.g. "bytes=-32123") are not asking for the last N
bytes of an object; they are asking for *up to* the last N bytes, or
the whole thing if fewer than N bytes are available. In the EC
machinery, we had code that assumed "has no bytes" == "unsatisfiable",
which is not true in that specific case. Now we correctly handle a
suffix-byte-range request that is satisfiable but receives zero bytes.

Change-Id: I8295a6c1436f50f86a4c626d87de6bfedd74ab09
Closes-Bug: 1736840

commit_message:
Fix new PEP8 errors

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings, this
fixes E402, E731 and W503 new occurrences

Also fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs job fails with pip 10, showing an error when
pip install fails when called without any package name

Change-Id: I85ec161c09d62b89149582c3e8d220b35fbcd260
(cherry picked from commit 17d5b784cc6d9ff8c43957109c45fbee40499144)

[{'created': '2018-05-23 08:39:12.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix authentication along with add multi extra volumes

This commit will fix authentication in boot from volume (BFV) feature,
which use the volumes from Cinder for Baremetal via Ironic.

Each volume will need pair of account for authentication when perform
sanhook into SAN device via iPXE. And sandboot from drive 0x80 (default)
also need pair accounts same with the iscsi sanhook on drive 0x80 with
multi volumes has supported.

Co-authored-By: Hoang Trung Hieu <hieuht@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I98f658cced8491872d39adbd8e0a1a643dd24868
Story: #2001824

'}, {'created': '2018-05-24 01:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix authentication issues along with add multi extra volumes

This commit will fix authentication in boot from volume (BFV) feature,
which use the volumes from Cinder for Baremetal via Ironic.

Each volume will need pair of account for authentication when perform
sanhook into SAN device via iPXE. And sandboot from drive 0x80 (default)
also need pair accounts same with the iscsi sanhook on drive 0x80 with
multi volumes has supported.

NOTE:
- We could add more than two volumes into iSCSI Boot Firmware Table(iBFT)
- Due to Linux does not support an iBFT that has more than two volumes,
  thus BFV only support for add one etra volume. If over two volume in iBFT
  then machine will raise "iBFT error: Control header is invalid!".
- Our code-base already for more than two volumes in iBFT, If Linux kernel
  bugs[1] is fixing this issue then we can use BFV with more than two volumes.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/acpi/actbl1.h#n1567

Co-authored-By: Hoang Trung Hieu <hieuht@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-authored-By: Dao Cong Tien <tiendc@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Fix authentication issues along with add multi extra volumes

This commit will fix authentication in boot from volume (BFV) feature,
which use the volumes from Cinder for Baremetal via Ironic.

Each volume will need pair of account for authentication when perform
sanhook into SAN device via iPXE. And sandboot from drive 0x80 (default)
also need pair accounts same with the iscsi sanhook on drive 0x80 with
multi volumes has supported.

NOTE:
- We could add more than two volumes into iSCSI Boot Firmware Table(iBFT)
- Due to Linux does not support an iBFT that has more than two volumes,
  thus BFV only support for add one etra volume. If over two volume in iBFT
  then machine will raise "iBFT error: Control header is invalid!".
- Our code-base already for more than two volumes in iBFT, If Linux kernel
  bugs[1] is fixing this issue then we can use BFV with more than two volumes.

Tested successfully on Fujitsu Baremetal Server TX2540 M1.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/acpi/actbl1.h#n1567

Co-authored-By: Hoang Trung Hieu <hieuht@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-authored-By: Dao Cong Tien <tiendc@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I98f658cced8491872d39adbd8e0a1a643dd24868
Story: #2001824
Task: #12573

subject: Use X-Timestamp when checking object expiration

(1 comment)

Who's to say it's not the PROXY who's time has drifted?  a GET will take any 200 it can get.. this might be our last chance to respond with the expired data?!"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-23 21:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

In the EC case, though, you need multiple 200s -- at least this way, there's a singlular concept of "now" for the request. Otherwise clients may get back a 503 (I think? I forget) when doing a GET around the expiration time because *some* copies 200 and *some* copies 404 despite the replicators being fully caught-up.

If we trust the proxy (and now that we've got https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/31c294d) and your replicators are keeping up, then either they all 200 or they all 404. Yeah?'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-24 19:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-24 21:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-24 21:13:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 18:35:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix object POST of X-Delete-At with skewed clocks

If one object server's clock is ahead of the proxy server's clock for
some reason, and a client makes a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
then the skewed-time object server may refuse the new X-Delete-At
value.

In a cluster where two of the three replicas for an object live on the
same time-skewed node, this can result in confusing behavior for
clients. A client can make a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
receive a 400, and then discover later that the X-Delete-At value was
updated anyway, since one object server accepted the POST and
replication spread the new metadata around.

This commit makes the object server's POST handler use the request's
X-Timestamp value to determine whether the request's X-Delete-At value
is in the past or not. This way, all object servers will agree whether
the new X-Delete-At is, or is not, in the past.

Change-Id: I10c28f97d4c6aca1d64bef3b93506cfbb50ade30
"}, {'created': '2018-01-11 20:55:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use X-Timestamp when checking object expiration

In the object server's PUT, POST, and DELETE handlers, we use the
request's X-Timestamp value for checking object expiration. In the GET
and HEAD handlers, we use it if present, but default to the current
time. That way, one can still use curl to make direct object GET or
HEAD requests as before.

If one object server's clock is ahead of the proxy server's clock for
some reason, and a client makes a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
then the skewed-time object server may refuse the new X-Delete-At
value.

In a cluster where two of the three replicas for an object live on the
same time-skewed node, this can result in confusing behavior for
clients. A client can make a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
receive a 400, and then discover later that the X-Delete-At value was
updated anyway, since one object server accepted the POST and
replication spread the new metadata around.

DELETE is somewhat less confusing. The client might get a spurious 404
in the above case, but the object will still be removed.

For PUT, an object server with a slow clock might refuse to overwrite
an object with an "older" one because it believes the on-disk object
is newer than the current time.

Change-Id: I10c28f97d4c6aca1d64bef3b93506cfbb50ade30
'}, {'created': '2018-01-13 01:09:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use X-Timestamp when checking object expiration

If one object server's clock is ahead of the proxy server's clock for
some reason, and a client makes a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
then the skewed-time object server may refuse the new X-Delete-At

In a cluster where two of the three replicas for an object live on the

DELETE is somewhat less confusing. The client might get a spurious 404
in the above case, but the object will still be removed.

For PUT, an object server with a slow clock might refuse to overwrite
an object with an "older" one because it believes the on-disk object
is newer than the current time.

Change-Id: I10c28f97d4c6aca1d64bef3b93506cfbb50ade30
'}, {'created': '2018-01-22 18:56:42.000000000', 'message': 'Use X-Timestamp when checking object expiration

commit_message:
Use X-Timestamp when checking object expiration

In the object server's PUT, POST, and DELETE handlers, we use the
request's X-Timestamp value for checking object expiration. In the GET
and HEAD handlers, we use it if present, but default to the current
time. That way, one can still use curl to make direct object GET or
HEAD requests as before.

If one object server's clock is ahead of the proxy server's clock for
some reason, and a client makes a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
then the skewed-time object server may refuse the new X-Delete-At
value.

In a cluster where two of the three replicas for an object live on the
same time-skewed node, this can result in confusing behavior for
clients. A client can make a POST request to update X-Delete-At,
receive a 400, and then discover later that the X-Delete-At value was
updated anyway, since one object server accepted the POST and
replication spread the new metadata around.

DELETE is somewhat less confusing. The client might get a spurious 404
in the above case, but the object will still be removed.

For PUT, an object server with a slow clock might refuse to overwrite
an object with an "older" one because it believes the on-disk object
is newer than the current time.

Change-Id: I10c28f97d4c6aca1d64bef3b93506cfbb50ade30

commit_message:
Remove some Python 2.6 compatibility code in ring

Looks like you couldn't wrap an io.BufferedReader around a
gzip.GzipFile in 2.6, but you can starting in 2.7, so we don't need to
check for some private attribute to ensure compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib8f7378a7d8e17e0684702a9d94307d4c33cd4c8

commit_message:
Add detail to container server GET docstring

The container server GET method became more complex with the
introduction of shard ranges [1]. This patch adds some commentary to
the docstring. The additional docstring is not intended to be
exhaustive, particularly where it would duplicate the API docs.

[1] Related-Change: I029782ae348f38c5fb76d2759609f67a06c883ef

Change-Id: Id661f5dd67768e1698901ca06e33900291e80964

commit_message:
Implements baremetal inspect abort

This patch implements the feature of baremetal inspect abort.

For a node in inspect wait state, an abort request initiates the process of
introspection abort.

Adds transision from ``inspect wait`` to ``inspect failed`` with event
``abort`` to the state machine.

Adds an ``abort`` interface to ``InspectInterface``, which raises
UnsupportedDriverExtension by default.

Implements the ``abort`` interface for ironic inspector inspect interface.

API microversion is bumped for backwards compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #10602
Story: #1703089
Task: #10602

Change-Id: I02a39ed08c7c64b36c6ef05678f0af6d8324c5e2

commit_message:
Avoid showing password in log

per bug indicated, the password is shown in the log.

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/strutils.py#L295
indicated auth_password can be masked through mask_password method.

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts caused by Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022
and Ifc01dbf98545104c998ab96f65ff8623a6db0f28 not being present in Pike.
Additionally If12e7860baad2899380f06144a0270784a5466b8 was not present
in Queens but landed in Pike and Ocata as a stable only change.

Change-Id: I725eea1866642b40cc6b065ed0e8aefb91ca2889
Closes-Bug: 1761054
(cherry picked from commit 1b61d6c08c7c86834acab45320230824b88d529c)
(cherry picked from commit df90dfd5cdf76c65b8d8a539d79e384c82c8428c)
(cherry picked from commit 978066fe31a5331f143a05e1fd753c729b2dcf09)

commit_message:
Fix requirements gate + add local tox profile

Add a local tox profile 'requirements' so we can easily run requirements
checks locally during development.

Change-Id: I4d1718b6ff67a889984d8937241d086f06bef237

(1 comment)

I consider it a good idea to present lists in a deterministic, easy-to-search order. I have one small concern though. I'm not sure if sorting belongs to the API level. I usually try to keep sorting close to where the data is displayed, because the same data may need to be displayed in different sort orders in different places.

But this way this patch is already an improvement so I won't vote -1 just because of this."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2017-08-29 22:59:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Bence, thanks the review and I agree with you. The sort should be done close to where the data is displayed. Besides, though the Nova API ref say the API can support passing in multi key/dir pairs, but I can't see how it works based on the code https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/flavors.py#L80.

So overall, I prefer to do the sort here to provide a better experience for end user. Our customer are really frustrating the order now :("}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2017-08-29 23:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-29 23:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

I don't think the sorting should be done in the api either. A sorted list is not always needed so the flavors should be sorted before they are shown on the launch instance modal. Also, can you add a bug report for this? Thanks."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-09-04 06:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The django version of Launch Instance form provides a way that operators can specify the sort order of flavors [1]. Don't we want to have the similar feature in the Angular launch instance form?

At least, I don't think it is a good idea to have a hard-coded sorting logic.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/configuration/settings.html#create-instance-flavor-sort"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2017-09-04 21:59:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Ying Zuo, thanks for the review. I didn't create a but because I don't think it's bug. It's most like a tiny enhancement. But I don't mind create one to track it and add a RFE tag on that."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2017-09-04 23:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Akihiro, thanks for the review. I almost forgot how the old django form looks like, thanks for the code, I found it finally. And I agree it would be nice if we can reuse the existing config for the anjularjs version. I will propose a new patch set. Cheers.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2017-09-04 23:20:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:
